commit_message:
Add docimpact group for fuel-* projects

Allows DocImpact tag usage (see
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/DocImpact)

fuel-specs and fuel-docs are omitted

Change-Id: Ib09370fced66b5ba479b6d96a94c7a820214f82c

commit_message:
Add templates for replica and replica source

This patch adds templates for replica and replica source.
Previously this was hard coded in the code. This gives
deployers the ability to customize their replication
configurations.

Closes-Bug: 1370125

Change-Id: Ie1b4cff1685d2577240eb43ffecac3c977ba964c

commit_message:
Convert unicode to UTF8 when calling ldap.str2dn()

The string passed to ldap.str2dn() needs to be UTF8 encoded, otherwise
we encounter UnicodeEncodeError exceptions.

This patch adds UTF8 encoding where it was missing for ldap.str2dn()
calls as well as some unit tests to cover the functions that were
lacking this encoding step.

Change-Id: I96e718f1d43f4aad272ca4990d3905a5adf1f07d
Closes-bug: #1375139

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-27 16:16:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/c2c897e240714cffd09b17d5c0e5c2649b88ea84', 'message': 'Close listener connection after stopping rpcserver

Currently listener connection is not closed after stoping rpc server.

So when rpc server restarts after receiving SIGHUP signal, it has two
listeners. One which is not closed while stopping and other
which is created while starting the rpc server.

This is causing issue in processing messages properly.

Closes-Bug: #1335086

remains open and the next time when the messages are sent on
the listening topic, then some of the messages will not be processed
as there is no dispatcher running to process the message.

commit_message:
Cleanup listener after stopping rpc server

If you don't close the AMQP connection, then the connection
remains open and the next time when the messages are sent on
the listening topic, then some of the messages will not be processed
as there is no dispatcher running to process the message.

Closes-Bug: #1335086
Change-Id: I1f39eedf1500b6b6209ae0222f32e08e304895e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/86/103186/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Close listener connection after completely processing all messages self._executor.listener.close_connection()

commit_message:
Add VNIC_TYPE in the portbinding for OpenContrail plugin

This patch adds the VNIC_TYPE for the OpenContrail plugin
when the port is created.
Nova expects VNIC_TYPE when it creates a port during instance
creation.

Change-Id: Ibfa8c5d10aea577c0e08b3e6256122b9946f1504
Closes-bug: #1373872

commit_message:
Adds an extension to enable password rotation

bp password-rotation

Change-Id: I18eaa87f1c5826a80ba10ebf13038719076f4634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/23/74623/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from oslo.config import cfg from testtools import matchers from keystone.common import controller from keystone import exception from keystone import tests from keystone.tests import test_v3 CONF = cfg.CONF class RotatingPasswordsTestCase(test_v3.RestfulTestCase): EXTENSION_TO_ADD = 'password_rotation_extension' def setUp(self): super(UserSelfServiceRotatingPasswordsTestCase, self).setUp() self.user_ref = self.new_user_ref(domain_id=self.domain['id']) self.identity_api.create_user(self.user_ref['id'], self.user_ref) self.token = self.get_request_token(self.user_ref['password'], 201) def get_request_token(self, password, expected_status): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user_ref['id'], password=password) r = self.post('/auth/tokens', body=auth_data, expected_status=expected_status) return r.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') def rotate_password(self, expected_status, **kwargs): """Returns a test response for a change password request.""" path = '/users/%s/OS-PW-ROTATE/password' % self.user_ref['id'] return self.post(path, body={'user': kwargs}, token=self.token, expected_status=expected_status) # def test_rotation(self): def Xtest_simple_rotating_passwords(self): # original password works self.get_request_token(self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=201) # change password new_password = uuid.uuid4().hex self.rotate_password(password=new_password, original_password=self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=204) # # # original password still works # self.get_request_token(self.user_ref['password'], # expected_status=201) # # # new password works # self.get_request_token(new_password, expected_status=201) def Xtest_old_password_after_expiration(self): pass def Xtest_manually_expiring_old_password(self): # original password works self.get_request_token(self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=201) # change password new_password = uuid.uuid4().hex self.rotate_password(password=new_password, original_password=self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=204) # expire old passwords self.delete('/users/%s/OS-PW-ROTATE/old_passwords' % self.user_ref['id']) # original password still works self.get_request_token(self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=201) # new password works self.get_request_token(new_password, expected_status=201)

commit_message:
Identity authentication now uses rotated passwords

A previous commit added the ability to store rotated passwords. The idea
is that the rotated passwords would be valid for authentication for some
configurable period of time. This commit enables those passwords to be
used. A future commit will add the ability to manage those password
through an extension API.

bp password-rotation

Change-Id: Ifc607f881aadae7c571352d38e6f7716a2c48150

commit_message:
Adds table and model for storing rotated passwords

They will be used by future commits to implement
bp password-rotation.

Change-Id: Idc4e6174c12fd584c914fcd3670658fadbf9510d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/68/73368/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import datetime from keystone.identity.backends import sql from keystone import tests def future_date(): """Returns a datetime representing a date 24hrs in the future.""" return datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(hours=24) def past_date(): """Returns a datetime representing a date 24hrs in the past.""" return datetime.datetime.utcnow() - datetime.timedelta(hours=24) class TestPasswordRotationCrudSQL(tests.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestPasswordRotationCrudSQL, self).setUp() self.driver = sql.Identity() tests.setup_database() self.addCleanup(tests.teardown_database) # create the sample data self.user_id = tests.new_id() future_rp = self._create_data(self.user_id, future_date()) self.future_rp = self.driver.create_rotated_password(future_rp) past_rp = self._create_data(self.user_id, past_date()) self.past_rp = self.driver.create_rotated_password(past_rp) def _create_data(self, user_id, expires_at): return { 'id': tests.new_id(), 'user_id': user_id, 'password': tests.new_id(), 'expires_at': expires_at, } def test_retrieving_all_rotated_passwords(self): rotated_passwords = self.driver.list_rotated_passwords_by_user( self.user_id, None) self.assertEqual(len(rotated_passwords), 2) self.assertIn(self.future_rp, rotated_passwords) self.assertIn(self.past_rp, rotated_passwords) def test_retrieving_active_rotated_passwords(self): rotated_passwords = self.driver.list_active_rotated_passwords_by_user( self.user_id, None) self.assertEqual(len(rotated_passwords), 1) self.assertIn(self.future_rp, rotated_passwords) def test_deleting_expired_rotated_passwords(self): # create another user's data to make sure we don't delete it too other_user_id = tests.new_id() other_user_rp = self._create_data(other_user_id, past_date()) other_user_rp = self.driver.create_rotated_password(other_user_rp) # do the delete self.driver.delete_expired_rotated_passwords_by_user(self.user_id) rotated_passwords = self.driver.list_rotated_passwords_by_user( self.user_id, None) self.assertEqual(len(rotated_passwords), 1) self.assertIn(self.future_rp, rotated_passwords) # assert the other user's data is still there rotated_passwords = self.driver.list_rotated_passwords_by_user( other_user_id, None) self.assertEqual(len(rotated_passwords), 1) self.assertIn(other_user_rp, rotated_passwords)

HOT guide: manage instances

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/96/116496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. For consistency let's define a few values to use in the samples: * image name: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64 * shared/provider network name and ID: "ext-net", "893aebb9-1c1e-48be-8908-6b947f3237b3" * tenant network and subnet names and IDs: "demo-net", "50da30bd-05b4-404c-8f43-9e34bfd9903d" "demo-subnet", "7709a947-2059-4633-a53b-ac4ac624ecc7" Use the ``OS::Glance::Image`` resource to register an image in the OpenStack Image service. For example: .. code-block:: yaml resources: my_new_image: type: OS::Glance::Image properties: name: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" location: "http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/trusty/current/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img" container_format: "bare" disk_format: "qcow2" is_public: TrueUse the ``OS::Cinder::Volume`` resource to create a new Block Storage volume. For example: .. code-block:: yaml resources: my_new_volume: type: OS::Cinder::Volume properties: size: 10 name: "MyVolume" The volumes that you create are empty by default. Use the ``image`` property to create a bootable volume from an existing image: .. code-block:: yaml resources: my_new_bootable_volume: type: OS::Cinder::Volume properties: size: 10 name: "MyBootableVolume" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" You can also create new volumes from another volume, a volume snapshot, or a volume backup. Use the ``source_volid``, ``snapshot_id`` or ``backup_id`` properties to create a new volume from an existing source. For example, to create a new volume from a backup: .. code-block:: yaml resources: another_volume: type: OS::Cinder::Volume properties: name: "AnotherVolume" backup_id: "2fff50ab-1a9c-4d45-ae60-1d054d6bc868" In this example the ``size`` property is not defined because the Block Storage service uses the size of the backup as size for the new volume. The Networking service (neutron) must be enabled on your OpenStack deployment to create and manage networks and subnets. Use the ``OS::Neutron::Net`` resource to create a network, and the ``OS::Neutron::Subnet`` resource to provide a subnet for this network: .. code-block:: yaml resources: new_net: type: OS::Neutron::Net properties: name: "MyNet" new_subnet: type: OS::Neutron::Subnet properties: name: "MySubnet" network_id: { get_resource: new_net } cidr: "10.8.1.0/24" dns_nameservers: [ "8.8.8.8", "8.8.4.4" ] ip_version: 4 Create and manage a router -------------------------- Use the ``OS::Neutron::Router`` resource to create a router. You can define its gateway by defining the ``external_gateway_info`` property: .. code-block:: yaml resources: router1: type: OS::Neutron::Router properties: name: "router1" external_gateway_info: network: "893aebb9-1c1e-48be-8908-6b947f3237b3" You can connect subnets to the router you create with the ``OS::Neutron::RouterInterface`` resource: .. code-block:: yaml resources: subnet1_interface: type: OS::Neutron::RouterInterface properties: router_id: "635660ae-a254-4feb-8993-295aa9ec6418" subnet: "69d38773-794a-4e49-b887-6de6734e792d" Complete network example ------------------------ The following example creates a network stack: * a network and its associated subnet * a router with an external gateway * an interface to the new subnet for the new router In this examples, the ``ext-net`` network is an existing shared network. .. code-block:: yaml resources: internal_net: type: OS::Neutron::Net properties: name: "internal_net" internal_subnet: type: OS::Neutron::Subnet properties: name: "internal_subnet" network_id: { get_resource: internal_net } cidr: "10.8.1.0/24" dns_nameservers: [ "8.8.8.8", "8.8.4.4" ] ip_version: 4 internal_router: type: OS::Neutron::Router properties: name: "router" external_gateway_info: { network: "ext-net" } internal_interface: type: OS::Neutron::RouterInterface properties: router_id: { get_resource: internal_router } subnet: { get_resource: internal_subnet }Use the ``OS::Nova::Server`` resource to create a Compute instance. The following example creates a simple instance: .. code-sample:: yaml resources: instance: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: name: "MyInstance" flavor: "m1.small" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" networks: - network: "50da30bd-05b4-404c-8f43-9e34bfd9903d" When you create an instance, use the ``networks`` property to define which networks this instance should connect to. Define each network as a YAML map, containing one of the following keys: ``network`` The name or ID of an existing network. You don't need to create an ``OS::Neutron::Port`` resource if you use this property, but you will not be able to associate a floating IP with the instance interface in the template. ``port`` The ID of an existing Networking port. You usually create this port in the same template using an ``OS::Neutron::Port`` resource. You will be able to associate a floating IP to this port and to your Compute instance. The following example demonstrates the use of the ``port`` and ``network`` properties: .. code-block:: yaml resources: instance_port: type: OS::Neutron::Port properties: network_id: "50da30bd-05b4-404c-8f43-9e34bfd9903d" fixed_ips: - subnet_id: "7709a947-2059-4633-a53b-ac4ac624ecc7" instance: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: name: "instance" flavor: "m1.small" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" networks: - port: { get_resource: instance_port } - network: "893aebb9-1c1e-48be-8908-6b947f3237b3" Create and associate security groups to an instance --------------------------------------------------- Use the ``OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup`` resource to create security groups. Use the ``security_groups`` list property of the ``OS::Neutron::Port`` resource to associate security groups to a port, then associate the port to an instance. The following example creates a security group allowing inbound connection on ports 80 and 443 (web server) and associates it to an instance port: .. code-block:: yaml resources: web_secgroup: type: OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup properties: name: "web-secgroup" rules: - protocol: "tcp" remote_ip_prefix: "0.0.0.0/0" port_range_min: 80 port_range_max: 80 - protocol: "tcp" remote_ip_prefix: "0.0.0.0/0" port_range_min: 443 port_range_max: 443 instance_port: type: OS::Neutron::Port properties: network_id: "50da30bd-05b4-404c-8f43-9e34bfd9903d" security_groups: [ "default", { get_resource: web_secgroup } ] fixed_ips: - subnet_id: "7709a947-2059-4633-a53b-ac4ac624ecc7" instance: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: name: "instance" flavor: "m1.small" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" networks: [ port: { get_resource: instance_port } ] .. FIXME: the following paragraph is not entirely true, the OS::Nova::FloatingIP resource can also be used and should work with neutron as well. But this needs some testing You cannot directly associate a floating IP to an instance resource in a HOT template as you do with the :program:`nova boot` command. You need to associate the floating IP to an ``OS::Neutron::Port`` resource, and associate this port to the instance. Use the ``OS::Neutron::FloatingIP`` resource to create a floating IP and associate it to a port: .. code-block:: yaml resources: instance_floating_ip: type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIP properties: floating_network_id: "82b58bba-e75b-4f75-a5dc-7bf19f5a4b49" port_id: { get_resource: instance_port } Use the ``OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation`` resource to associate an existing floating IP to a port: .. code-block:: yaml resources: instance_floating_ip: type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation properties: floatingip_id: "dcf3fb7d-5bfc-43f0-b45a-eed94935dede" port_id: { get_resource: instance_port } Create a key pair ----------------- Use the ``OS::Nova::KeyPair`` resource to create a new key pair. If the ``public_key`` property is not specified, the Orchestration module will create a new key pair. If the ``save_private_key`` property is set to ``true``, the ``private_key`` attribute of the resource will hold the private key. The following example creates a new key pair and uses it as authentication key for an instance: .. code-block:: yaml resources: my_key: type: OS::Nova::KeyPair properties: name: "my_key" save_private_key: true my_instance: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: name: "instance" flavor: "m1.small" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" key_name: { get_resource: my_key } networks: [ port: { get_resource: instance_port } ] outputs: private_key: description: Private key value: { get_attr: [ my_key, private_key ] } Use the ``OS::Cinder::VolumeAttachment`` resource to attach a volume to an instance. The following example creates a volume and an instance, and attaches the volume to the instance: .. code-block:: yaml resources: new_volume: type: OS::Cinder::Volume properties: size: 1 new_instance: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: name: "inst1" flavor: "m1.small" image: "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64" volume_attachment: type: OS::Cinder::VolumeAttachment properties: volume_id: { get_resource: new_volume } instance_uuid: { get_resource: new_instance } .. TODO - Booting from a volume

subject: add {pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-src-{name} job template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-01 17:27:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/d1b83af2c6a94ee9c9e2e7b83f936d3734672cd7', 'message': "add {pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-src-{project} job template

This job allows us to hand up a single project that will be designated

commit_message:
add {pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-src-{name} job template

This job allows us to hand up a single project that will be designated
as project from source. With this we can use the new devstack
refactorings to provide forward testing for libraries so that they can
see that they don't break all of openstack.

Change-Id: Id5ac1517be3a8697063b39fc1fbc0eb35b5ba449

commit_message:
Rework coverage jobs

Remove coverage job from python-jobs since many projects are not setup
for it.

Add the coverage job back to each project where coverage currently
succeeds.

Change-Id: I0e480827a2f1990945b3dff0ab08a5559ff40c03

commit_message:
Improve documentation around usage of cinder-volume-nfs

This change aims at improving the doc around usage of the different
cinder backend elements, particularily cinder-volume-nfs.

We also remove cinder-volume from the BLOCKSTORAGE image elements as
it will be eventually installed as dependency by one of the
cinder-* backend elements.

Change-Id: Id553b15227c0b980702174d7d2a0410ab30dcce4

subject: glance plugin should not upload on unauthorised
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-11 07:24:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c64060b92076f240a032705bc695483bf192ca3f', 'message': 'glance plugin should not upload on unauthorised

The glance plugin tries to upload for invalid auth token.
In nova/image/glance, the X-Auth-Token is taken from the context, and
passed on to upload. And in the upload_tarball method, the plugin starts
to put the headers and upload the image, and only after all the chunks
are uploaded it will receive an UnAuthorized response.This results in an
unnecessary upload of all the chunks.

Fix: Have a "HEAD" call made with the same X-Auth-Token and other
headers. If that returns a 401, then abandon the upload process.
Otherwise, continue with the upload.

Fixes bug Bug #1238393

commit_message:
glance plugin should not upload on unauthorised

The glance plugin tries to upload for invalid auth token.
In nova/image/glance, the X-Auth-Token is taken from the context, and
passed on to upload. And in the upload_tarball method, the plugin starts
to put the headers and upload the image, and only after all the chunks
are uploaded it will receive an UnAuthorized response.This results in an
unnecessary upload of all the chunks.

Fix: Have a "HEAD" call made with the same X-Auth-Token and other
headers. If that returns a 401, then abandon the upload process.
Otherwise, continue with the upload.

Fixes bug Bug #1238393
Change-Id: Ic47e94245980c6f08e56ef28f910a5cde598d2d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/51132/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #Note(basha): In case an anauthorised is returned, break off # immediately without uploading the entire chunk try: conn.putrequest('HEAD', '/v1/images/%s' % image_id) except Exception, error: raise RetryableError(error) for header, value in extra_headers.iteritems(): conn.putheader(header, value) conn.endheaders() resp = conn.getresponse() if resp.status is httplib.UNAUTHORIZED: #No point uploading the chunk on unauthorized raise PluginError("Got unauthorized response [%i] while uploading " "image [%s] " "to glance host [%s:%s]" % (resp.status, image_id, glance_host, glance_port))

OfficialClientManager from the tenant isolation classes.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-30 14:49:41.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5380ddaadb0ce34b866b097cb6ac1396d2b30100', 'message': 'Fix parsing of emulated enabled DN

If a non-default emulated enabled DN is specified in configuration,
the DN structure returned from python-ldap is incorrectly converted
to a string.  This leads to an index error when we attempt to extract
the RDN attribute and value.

This patch removes the incorrect string conversion and instead does

commit_message:
Fix parsing of emulated enabled DN

If a non-default emulated enabled DN is specified in configuration,
the DN structure returned from python-ldap is incorrectly converted
to a string.  This leads to an index error when we attempt to extract
the RDN attribute and value.

This patch removes the incorrect string conversion and instead does
the proper conversion on the RDN strings that we extract.

Change-Id: I8f0c4594cfa9a41e1875870c3eb63fae32c8c041
Resolves-bug: #1375772

commit_message:
remove scary error message in tox

Found an interesting cantrip in the devstack tox.ini that gets rid of
the scary can't find bash error message at the beginning of test
runs. Reducing non error looking error things make it easier to see
real errors.

Change-Id: I4e1b826626063bf8d5a15531f5768f9ce0eea6a5

commit_message:
Add bash and find to tox whitelist_externals

Stop triggering a not installed in virtualenv every time
bash or find is called. No need for these unnecessary warnings all over the place.

Change-Id: I32e8916b187f46937f5b5f94ccff8ae68ca34828

commit_message:
move integrated api client to requests library

The integrated api client previously did the HTTPConnection /
HTTPSConnection url parsing dance. In python 2.x HTTPSConnection
doesn't care about SSL certs at all. While not actually an issue for
these tests, it does mean we keep around an example in the code that
uses HTTPSConnection, which will prevent us from creating a hacking
rule to keep those out once the other 4 actual security issues with
HTTPSConnection are removed.

Change-Id: Idd7d5a055600dda663f9c56b39883510f8688b12
Related-Bug: #1188189

commit_message:
Code clean-up due to type order enhancement

Removed code related old Order. Cleaned redundant
fields from Order model. Also cleaned the API, no
more support for old style orders.

- Fixed broken functional test
- Fixed alembic version conflict due to CR 122498

Closes-Bug: 1335171

Change-Id: I33fe7a75568e0108c623e8f6f786fb9e9b888d36

commit_message:
Use DbTestCase as test base when context needed

There is tests.db.base.DbTestCase class which inherits from
tests.base.TestCase and adds context to test case object. Some test
cases initialize context in their setUp method, so to avoid this
initialization and unnecessary imports tests.db.base.DbTestCase can
be used as their base class.

Change-Id: I46cf7d1a33f8fbaa7d720bcfc574c9640ef83c06

commit_message:
Include parameters info in stack-abandon data

Currently on stack-adopt parameters from the original stack are
not adopted. With this change stack abandon data includes parameters
info and that data will be used on stack-adopt.

subject: Move begin ping listener to a connect listener
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-30 14:42:28.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/__init__.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_engine_connect.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/engine_connect.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/0bb1e236daae53a3f5b4b88761d7b19f7961ed6c', 'message': 'Move begin ping listener to a connect listener

The "reconnect" listener that occurs on transaction begin
is not sufficient for libraries that use engines, connections
and sessions in "autocommit" mode, where no transaction is begun.
So we move our "ping" from the begin phase to the "connect"
phase instead.   We use a newer SQLAlchemy event "engine_connect"
so that we can make use of the Connection and all the disconnect/
invalidation facilities that are included, rather than using
the low-level pool listener which is somewhat legacy.
Since the event was added in SQLAlchemy 0.9.0, a compatibility
layer is added which emulates the mechanics of the
handle_error compatibility layer.

Change-Id: I719fe45e657e747e5f8d64f20059e2b61c79b63d
Closes-bug: #1374497
(cherry picked from commit 228531013b4121531777878659e6e573029bacbc)
'}]
commit_message:
Move begin ping listener to a connect listener

The "reconnect" listener that occurs on transaction begin
is not sufficient for libraries that use engines, connections
and sessions in "autocommit" mode, where no transaction is begun.
So we move our "ping" from the begin phase to the "connect"
phase instead.   We use a newer SQLAlchemy event "engine_connect"
so that we can make use of the Connection and all the disconnect/
invalidation facilities that are included, rather than using
the low-level pool listener which is somewhat legacy.
Since the event was added in SQLAlchemy 0.9.0, a compatibility
layer is added which emulates the mechanics of the
handle_error compatibility layer.

Change-Id: I719fe45e657e747e5f8d64f20059e2b61c79b63d
Closes-bug: #1374497
(cherry picked from commit 228531013b4121531777878659e6e573029bacbc)

commit_message:
Fix kafka_consumer detection plugin

The monasca-setup process was throwing an unhandled exception
when the kafka_consumer detection plugin runs on servers where
kafa is not installed or configured.

Also, it should log errors instead of exceptions when something
fails during detection, like the other plugins do.

Change-Id: I7870cd01e4241f6f13683b22fa96810da6d301e3

commit_message:
Introduce tripleo-puppet-elements into OpenStack

tripleo-puppet-elements aim to be the way to configure OpenStack images
by using Puppet tool.

It includes:
- basic structure copied from tripleo-image-elements
- Gerrit permissions to puppet core team.

Official programm approval: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123826/

Change-Id: I9971d5e0c95f941774ce0b2fcfc822f613bd2afd

commit_message:
Upgrade and unbundle jquery-ui

Upgrade jquery-ui to >=1.10.1 and unbundle it to an xstatic package.

Since versions 1.10 and 1.11 use different directory structure, there is
a small conditional in the settings, using different paths depending on
the version.

Change-Id: If5116ec33cdb31b045d5c1c21b9640b38ff05f5e
Closes-bug: #1367720
Blueprint: remove-javascript-bundling
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/120411/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import xstatic.pkg.jquery_uiSTATICFILES_DIRS = [] if xstatic.main.XStatic(xstatic.pkg.jquery_ui).version.startswith('1.10.'): # The 1.10.x versions already contain the 'ui' directory. STATICFILES_DIRS.append(('horizon/lib/jquery-ui', xstatic.main.XStatic(xstatic.pkg.jquery_ui).base_dir)) else: # Newer versions dropped the directory, add it to keep the path the same. STATICFILES_DIRS.append(('horizon/lib/jquery-ui/ui', xstatic.main.XStatic(xstatic.pkg.jquery_ui).base_dir))

commit_message:
f20 is non voting, should only run on master

The fedora job remains non voting, it should only be tracking on
master not on all the stable branches where it just burns nodes.

commit_message:
remove all grenade-icehouse jobs

The grenade icehouse jobs are about upgrading from havana -> icehouse,
however that means a functional and supported havana tree, which we
don't have.

Thus remove them.

Change-Id: I1566d2d4448ed8ba172156f1ffa672b74eac4399

commit_message:
Fix issue with hardcoded versions for requirements

We need to build fuel images with all packages from master branch
and also we need support build from current stable version too.

Added python-babel to satisfy nailgun dependency

Change-Id: I609fe6f4185d37134842332b9d35cfcb3e2e4cb6
Closes-Bug: #1361279
blueprint fuel-deploy-juno

commit_message:
Drop stable/havana changes from official channels

As the stable/havana branches of official projects are being
deleted, there's no point in having these branches in the
announcement filters for those channels any longer. Note that this
does not remove it from unofficial/stackforge projects which may
still be using those branch names for other purposes.

Change-Id: If3bdc15ab1f0bb73138de1bdf735a5f3318579ab

Delete stable/havana job configs

With the stable/havana jobs no longer in use, it is safe to cease
configuring them any longer.

commit_message:
Add "ironic node-set-power-state" cmd unit test

This patch set add unit tests for "ironic node-set-power-state" command.
Valid power states are:
* on
* off
* reboot

Change-Id: I2ece16dbe7757763a9ec04281db646e3c879ebb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/67/124267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_do_node_set_power_state_on(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.node = 'node_uuid' args.power_state = 'on' n_shell.do_node_set_power_state(client_mock, args) client_mock.set_power_state('node_uuid', 'on') def test_do_node_set_power_state_off(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.node = 'node_uuid' args.power_state = 'off' n_shell.do_node_set_power_state(client_mock, args) client_mock.set_power_state('node_uuid', 'off') def test_do_node_set_power_state_reboot(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.node = 'node_uuid' args.power_state = 'reboot' n_shell.do_node_set_power_state(client_mock, args) client_mock.set_power_state('node_uuid', 'reboot')

commit_message:
Stop running jobs for stable/havana

The last Havana stable point release, 2013.2.4, has come and gone.
As it is no longer under support by the vulnerability management
team and stable branch maintainers, remove testing for it. Note that
this also means ceasing grenade jobs for stable/icehouse changes,
since they begin by deploying stable/havana.

Change-Id: Idac2f43d19dff78c3b0ff3c155f3835cafac446e

commit_message:
Run django-admin collectstatic for horizon

If other apps are installed alongside Horizon, we need to collect
all of the static artifacts, such as CSS and JS -- which Django has
support for, so make use of it.

As a consequence, set Horizon's ROOT_ROOT to a well-known path, and
create it if needed in install.d.

Change-Id: Icb2f511734ab882dda0b7d00ab73bd6b3cb961f7
Closes-Bug: #1363298

commit_message:
Correct deployment docs WRT setup-baremetal

setup-baremetal's interface changed quite some time ago, in commit
c686f0ea, so the deployment docs have been wrong since then. Correct
them to document the new world order.

Change-Id: Icf7f363b0008c24a14ae7d896e353b7e357bb3ab

deleted_lines: - IPMI (address, user, password) details for the three non-manually installed machines. - MAC addresses for all network interface cards in those same machines.- CPU count, memory in MB and disk in GB for your 4 machines. - register the undercloud machine with its details rather than generic virtual ones - e.g:: setup-baremetal 24 98304 1500 amd64 $somemac undercloud $ipmi_ip $ipmi_user $ipmi_password

commit_message:
Ensures only one resource is created into the backend

This change checks that the indexer backend doesn't create unwanted
resources.

Change-Id: Ia1a5cf2c1c92c64765aefe9357901280afa6245e

commit_message:
Don't try to load empty middleware

When we use cfg.MultiStrOpt, and the config file have a empty value
oslo.config return [''].

This change skips middleware named '', to allow to have no middleware
enabled.

Change-Id: I3d7f3d9ef6ff9f5690d6ee05ecffae51948c41d5
Related-Bugs: #1376231
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/33/125333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not middleware: continue

commit_message:
Fix parameter miss in test_snapshot_metadata test case

Exception.SnapshotNotFound exception should be passed snapshot_id
parameter, but the test case didn't pass it when raising this
exception.

Change-Id: Ic9b8cf7b647933b847a9602752ca87d141cda09e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/94/123994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.SnapshotNotFound(snapshot_id=snapshot_id)

commit_message:
Accept existing conf in dynamic_conf

Currently, dynamic_conf doesn't accept an existing conf object and
creates one from scratch every time. This patch adds a `conf` keyword to
both `can_connect` and `dynamic_conf` to re-use the already loaded
options from existing config objects.

This work is needed for the bug mentioned bellow.

Bug: #1372335
Change-Id: I471a33a80504802339accd82e632620d101a23df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/21/123721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy def dynamic_conf(uri, options, conf=None): if conf is None: conf = cfg.ConfigOpts() else: conf = copy.deepcopy(conf) if storage_group not in conf: conf.register_opts(storage_opts, group=storage_group) if 'drivers' not in conf: # NOTE(cpp-cabrera): parse general opts: 'drivers' driver_opts = utils.dict_to_conf({'storage': storage_type}) conf.register_opts(driver_opts, group=u'drivers') conf.set_override('uri', uri, group=storage_group)def load_storage_driver(conf, cache, storage_type=None, control_mode=False): :param storage_type: The storage_type to load. If None, then the `drivers` option will be used. storage_type = storage_type or conf['drivers'].storage storage_type,def can_connect(uri, conf=None): conf = dynamic_conf(uri, {}, conf=conf) storage_type = six.moves.urllib_parse.urlparse(uri).scheme driver = load_storage_driver(conf, None, storage_type=storage_type) return driver.is_alive() except Exception as exc: LOG.debug('Can\'t connect to: %s \n%s' % (uri, exc))
deleted_lines: def dynamic_conf(uri, options): # NOTE(cpp-cabrera): make it *very* clear to data storage # drivers that we are operating in a dynamic mode. general_opts = utils.dict_to_conf({'dynamic': True}) # NOTE(cpp-cabrera): parse general opts: 'drivers' driver_opts = utils.dict_to_conf({'storage': storage_type}) conf = cfg.ConfigOpts() conf.register_opts(general_opts) conf.register_opts(driver_opts, group=u'drivers') conf.register_opts(storage_opts, group=storage_group)def load_storage_driver(conf, cache, control_mode=False): conf['drivers'].storage,def can_connect(uri): driver_type = 'zaqar.queues.data.storage' storage_type = six.moves.urllib.parse.urlparse(uri).scheme conf = dynamic_conf(uri, {}) mgr = driver.DriverManager(driver_type, storage_type, invoke_on_load=True, invoke_args=[conf, None]) return mgr.driver.is_alive() except Exception: LOG.debug('Can\'t connect to: %s' % uri)

commit_message:
Revert "Enable the swift logs env vars for all jobs"

The zuul_swift_upload.py script doesn't work on centos. Revert
this commit to disable log uploading while we fix the script.

This reverts commit 63c57402838ed4c63c194c137dc4ea221e7b234d.

Change-Id: Ib2f29df4f9bd42de1e74f29f7f3e53ea2478e7ce

commit_message:
Make rescheduling of l3 agent more resilient

In order to make l3 agent restart more resilient
and idempotent do:

1) delete agent after resource is stopped and
all the stuff is cleaned up

2) reschedule not only dead routers/networks but also
orphaned routers/networks

3) enclose get_pid_list_for_ns_list function argument
in cleanup function into double quoutes
or it will use only the first argument
and will not work with several networks

Change-Id: I90338ff2df2703e121a6075ad1e60a442c88591f
Related-Bug: #1371550
Related-Bug: #1375817

commit_message:
Make rescheduling of l3 agent more resilient

In order to make l3 agent restart more resilient
and idempotent do:

1) delete agent after resource is stopped and
all the stuff is cleaned up

2) reschedule not only dead routers/networks but also
orphaned routers/networks

3) enclose get_pid_list_for_ns_list function argument
in cleanup function into double quoutes
or it will use only the first argument
and will not work with several networks

Change-Id: I90338ff2df2703e121a6075ad1e60a442c88591f
Related-Bug: #1371550
Related-Bug: #1375817

commit_message:
Fix tools/xen/functions for bashate errors

Change I205d675ff231c0403dd135eacc8d57b45317859f modified the matching
for bashate and it has started running on this file, whereas before it
wasn't.  This fixes the errors it is now picking up.

(cherry picked from commit 62cae13d7e7e13102a02aa385ae63b8e2afb7c83)

(We need to squash these 2 patches together to pass tests)

Use tox for bashate testing

Create a tox.ini file to install bashate into a virtualenv for running
tests. It can be run with a command such as "tox -v -ebashate". The find
command being used is equivalent to the default list of files discovered
by bashate plus the exclusion of the .tox/ directory. Also add the .tox/
directory to the .gitignore file.

Conflicts:
	.gitignore

Change-Id: I7876b5c94d90f15e3b0228999c0750bfbebcaa1c
(cherry picked from commit 0c256abd766265b8fdb11d354be7115c05bcaeb5)

commit_message:
Fix number of required arguments

The first argument is the name of the script itself, At least two
arguments are required. The second argument is the path to the
configuration file.

commit_message:
Run unit tests against MySQL

- Creates a new tox environment for testing against mysql
- Adds a script set-test-env-mysql.sh to set up mysql
- Adds a new file `functions.sh` for common shell functions
- Creates a new DB manager for tests
- Adds a new scenario for mysql in the MixinTestsWithBackendScenarios

Related to blueprint sql-unit-tests-on-real-backend
Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: I2c7378c79b1a0bffae5b2489b04c60e509f62f85

commit_message:
Update README to indicate being on Stackforge

This change updates the reference to Stackforge and also fixes
capitalization of OpenStack in the README. It also fixes a few minor
issues that were failing check tests.

Change-Id: I3bc4fc8515c1b3d56d789f1bb199e2cd512e6dbe

added_lines: The manila module is part of [Stackforge](https://github.com/stackforge), an effort by the OpenStack infrastructure team to provide continuous integration testing and code review for OpenStack and OpenStack community projects not part of the core software. The module its self is used to flexibly configure and manage the file system service for OpenStack.This module is tested in combination with other modules needed to build and leverage an entire OpenStack software stack. These modules can be found, all pulled together in the [openstack module](https://github.com/stackfoge/puppet-openstack).* manila, the file system service for OpenStack.* Initial commit

commit_message:
Fix UnboundLocalError during WebFault handling

If the document attribute of WebFault is unset, the 'detail' local
variable will be referenced before assignment which results in
UnboundLocalError. This patch fixes the problem by initializing
'detail' to None.

Change-Id: Icf17503f46eaa389b1f31dfffc84f21f69cde3aa
Closes-Bug: #1376172
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/92/125292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: doc = excep.document detail = None

commit_message:
Use faultstring attribute in suds.WebFault.fault

WebFault handling fails with AttributeError if there is no element at
path '/Envelope/Body/Fault/faultstring'. This patch fixes the problem
by using faultstring attribute in WebFault.fault.

Closes-Bug: #1371547
Change-Id: Ic61b22f833dd82f4c4e2d424f320526d1bd8eacd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/00/122700/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fault_string = None if excep.fault: fault_string = excep.fault.faultstring

commit_message:
rest: enable Keystone auth_token middleware by default

This changes enable the Keystone middleware by default so we are able to
authenticate users. The tests are updated to transparently send an
authentication token.

We rely on WebTest>=2.0.16 in order to be able to override the
do_request() method of the WebTest application

Change-Id: Ib4cda0db388f88fb5c8aac5a092ef58028c1d301
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/53/124753/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetimefrom oslo.utils import timeutils import pecanimport webtestclass FakeMemcache(object): VALID_TOKEN = '4562138218392831' USER_ID = str(uuid.uuid4()) PROJECT_ID = str(uuid.uuid4()) def get(self, key): if key == "tokens/%s" % self.VALID_TOKEN: dt = timeutils.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(minutes=5) return json.dumps(({'access': { 'token': {'id': self.VALID_TOKEN, 'expires': timeutils.isotime(dt)}, 'user': { 'id': self.USER_ID, 'name': 'myusername', 'tenantId': self.PROJECT_ID, 'tenantName': 'mytenant', 'roles': [ {'name': 'admin'}, ]}, }}, timeutils.isotime(dt))) @staticmethod def set(key, value, **kwargs): pass class TestingApp(webtest.TestApp): CACHE_NAME = 'fake.cache' def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(TestingApp, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) # Setup Keystone auth_token fake cache self.extra_environ.update({self.CACHE_NAME: FakeMemcache()}) def do_request(self, req, *args, **kwargs): req.headers['X-Auth-Token'] = FakeMemcache.VALID_TOKEN return super(TestingApp, self).do_request(req, *args, **kwargs) self.conf.import_opt("cache", "keystonemiddleware.auth_token", group="keystone_authtoken") self.conf.set_override("cache", TestingApp.CACHE_NAME, group='keystone_authtoken') self.app = TestingApp(pecan.load_app(c)) result = self.app.get("/", status=200)
deleted_lines: import pecan.testing self.app = pecan.testing.load_test_app(c) result = self.app.get("/") self.assertEqual(200, result.status_code)

commit_message:
indexer: remove entities from Entity

We stop declaring this resource type as being measurable, so it can't
have entities linked to it anymore.

Change-Id: I5a328bc37d59f8a680c5e5adcd31e13600bf6189

commit_message:
tests: fix race condition on archive policies

In some cases, one of the test might be creating the policies while the
other test is getting an error and trying to fetch them. But it might be
that the first test didn't finished to create all tests:

T1: create high policy -> OK
T2: create high policy -> KO
T2: get high policy -> OK
T2: get medium policy -> KO -> test fails!
T1: create medium policy -> OK

Let's fix that by creating or getting one policy at a time.

Change-Id: I5e4006decb9f8c50cb8d54d9f90c0ecdbd875a63

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: remove with_for_update()

This is not strictly useful as the code will handle correctly change if
they happen in the transaction, and it should avoid locking the database
too much.

Change-Id: Icaddfd5a029705af3d0437507ac725f2c84719b6

commit_message:
Make path for db_export_metadefs required

Currently if you call glance-manage db_export_metadefs without
any additional options, it will export all current metadefs
into the glance conf dir (e.g. /etc/glance/metadefs/) without
any warning. If the files already exist it will overwrite them.
Fix make glance-manage db_export_metadefs to require path
for destination folder to hold metadefs.
glance-manage db_export_metadefs /tmp

Change-Id: I00169fe9e3a9d26dd6d785771af6fa5e43639c8b
Closes-Bug: 1367011

commit_message:
ML2: move L3 cleanup out of network transaction

Move _process_l3_delete out of the delete_network
transaction to eliminate the semaphore deadlock that
occurs when it tries to delete the ports associated
with existing floating IPs.

It makes more sense to live outside of the transaction
anyway because the operations it performs cannot be
rolled back only in the database if the L3 plugin makes
external calls for floating IP creation/deletion.
e.g. if delete_floatingip is successful, it may have
deleted external resources and restoring the DB records
would make things inconsistent.

If a failure to delete the network does occur, any cleanup
done by _process_l3_delete will not be reversed.

Closes-Bug: #1374573

commit_message:
Reserve 10 migrations for backports

Reserve 10 migrations so that we have the option of backporting fixes
that include a db migration to the stable/juno branch.  We did this
same thing to allow backports and stable/icehouse in
d65139e6f4885869f80ee510f95f733473c579b6.

The choice of 10 migrations is just a magic number.  We haven't used any
of the 10 reserved in previous stable branches, so 10 seems to be enough.

Implements blueprint backportable-db-migrations-kilo

Change-Id: I3e6d2579b22222e51134e517a97f9daa5855382c

commit_message:
Partially address concerns in Couchbase restore strategy

This is a preliminary fix for community review. I expect to be making
some changes as well.

This change addresses some concerns about the Couchbase restore
strategy. In particular, the concerns that are addressed include
string injection in some execute calls, and issues around the
permissions on the secret file used to store the password.

This change set aims to fully address the issue around the password
file but is a partial solution to the string injection
problem. Additional changes are required to completely address
that. Some additional bugs have also been raised to address issues
related to other concerns discovered while fixing this bug. More to
come.

Change-Id: Icd8033caea4866f57f8cb4c5861d21797136ff90
Partial-Bug: #1349939

Add documentation on the EDP job engine SPI

added_lines: .. _get_edp_engine: get_edp_engine(cluster, job_type) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Returns an EDP job engine object that supports the specified job_type on the given cluster, or None if there is no support. The EDP job engine object returned must implement the interface described in :doc:`edp.spi`. The job_type should be a String matching one of the job types listed in :ref:`edp_spi_job_types`. *Returns*: an EDP job engine object or None

commit_message:
Explained the different console types available

Detailed the differences between the varying console types
available.

Also censored live IP with internal address and linked to
a security guide page for further information on VNC/SPICE
connections, which will be updated with more information.

Closes-Bug: 1364877
Change-Id: I5590a76d89b9d08ffb2bf690fda3b3f80df63ee7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/05/120405/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>In order to see the console output on an instance, regardless of whether or not the console log has output, VNC is used. VNC allows for relaying keyboard and mouse activity to and from the instance in question.</para> <para>There are 3 common VNC types in use with OpenStack:</para> <variablelist> <varlistentry><term>novnc</term> <listitem><para>An in-browser VNC client implemented using HTML5 Canvas and WebSockets</para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry><term>spice</term> <listitem><para>A complete in-browser VNC client solution for interaction with virtualized instances</para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry><term>xvpvnc</term> <listitem><para>A java client offering console access to an instance</para></listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist> <title>Example:</title>| xvpvnc | http://192.168.5.96:6081/console?token=c83ae3a3-15c4-4890-8d45-aefb494a8d6c |
deleted_lines: | xvpvnc | http://166.78.190.96:6081/console?token=c83ae3a3-15c4-4890-8d45-aefb494a8d6c |<note><para>To access an instance through a non-VNC console, specify the <parameter>novnc</parameter> parameter instead of the <parameter>xvpvnc</parameter> parameter.</para></note>

commit_message:
Fix Bad except clauses order

Invalid is an ancestor class of AutoDiskConfigDisabledByImage.
If we catch Invalid before, the user will be see a wrong message
"Invalid instance image." instead of "Requested Image has automatic
disk resize disabled."

Change-Id: Idb021c7da01ad7a1af07585be527773d14ff2d20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/86/124386/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: except exception.Invalid: msg = _("Invalid instance image.") raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

commit_message:
Fix rcdelivery.sh using wrong final version

upload_release.py needs the final release specified, not the milestone
version.

Change-Id: I04533e16e396a0d6ccb372533d7afba9dcf92403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/63/124963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FINALVERSION=${VERSION:0:6}echo "Final $SERIES version will be $FINALVERSION" $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $PROJECT $FINALVERSION $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $PROJECT $FINALVERSION --milestone=$MILESTONE $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $PROJECT $FINALVERSION --nop $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $PROJECT $FINALVERSION --milestone=$MILESTONE --nop

commit_message:
switch to oslo.utils

oslo.utils is released and corresponding code in oslo-incubator has
been removed.

Change-Id: Ic3a13380809a8b00c979e5ac405b4084f486a31d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/85/124785/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Import related utilities and helper functions. """ import sys import traceback def import_class(import_str): """Returns a class from a string including module and class.""" mod_str, _sep, class_str = import_str.rpartition('.') try: __import__(mod_str) return getattr(sys.modules[mod_str], class_str) except (ValueError, AttributeError): raise ImportError('Class %s cannot be found (%s)' % (class_str, traceback.format_exception(*sys.exc_info()))) def import_object(import_str, *args, **kwargs): """Import a class and return an instance of it.""" return import_class(import_str)(*args, **kwargs) def import_object_ns(name_space, import_str, *args, **kwargs): """Tries to import object from default namespace. Imports a class and return an instance of it, first by trying to find the class in a default namespace, then failing back to a full path if not found in the default namespace. """ import_value = "%s.%s" % (name_space, import_str) try: return import_class(import_value)(*args, **kwargs) except ImportError: return import_class(import_str)(*args, **kwargs) def import_module(import_str): """Import a module.""" __import__(import_str) return sys.modules[import_str] def try_import(import_str, default=None): """Try to import a module and if it fails return default.""" try: return import_module(import_str) except ImportError: return default

commit_message:
Add subnet tests for extra attributes

* Tests added for ipv4/6
test_create_delete_subnet_with_allocation_pools
test_create_delete_subnet_with_gw_and_allocation_pools
test_create_delete_subnet_with_host_routes_and_dns_nameservers
test_create_delete_subnet_with_dhcp_enabled
test_update_subnet_gw_dns_host_routes_dhcp
test_create_delete_subnet_all_attributes

* Adds helper to create/verify/delete subnet
* Adds helper to delete network

Implements: bp subnet-extra-attributes

Change-Id: I7c1b00f4fad797eb5dd904f1123b5bcd5e5af649
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/26/106326/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_delete_subnet_with_allocation_pools(self): net = netaddr.IPNetwork(CONF.network.tenant_network_cidr) name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] offset = net.size / 2 + 1 start = str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first + 2)) end = str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first + offset)) allocation_pools = [{'start': start, 'end': end}] kwargs = {'allocation_pools': allocation_pools} subnet = self.create_subnet(network, **kwargs) self.assertEqual(subnet['allocation_pools'], allocation_pools) # Delete network and subnet resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) self.subnets.pop()

commit_message:
Fix glance registry owner and group

Glance registry is started using the glance userid.
The owner/group of the glance registry conf and paste ini
should be glance user attribute, not hardcoded to root.

Change-Id: I7472e44c61e3d338a2d0bd5fca10511302d4ca43
Closes-Bug: #1375963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-image refs/changes/66/125166/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Fix glance registry owner/group to glance

commit_message:
Deny non-admin user update router-port

Change-Id: Ie0078c9f2a19322345eee806fcf6685bd89e53bf
Closes-bug: #1374398
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/124419/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: owner = (constants.DEVICE_OWNER_DHCP, constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF) if not context.is_admin and port['device_owner'] in owner: port_type = 'router' if 'dhcp' in port['device_owner']: port_type = 'dhcp' reason = _("Non admin user cannot update %s-port" % port_type) raise n_exc.AdminRequired(reason=reason)
deleted_lines: owner = constants.DEVICE_OWNER_DHCP if not context.is_admin and port['device_owner'] == owner: reason = _("Non admin user cannot update dhcp-port") raise n_exc.AdminRequired(reason=reason)

commit_message:
Deny non-admin user to update DHCP port

As decided in comments to related bug, non admin user should
not be able to update dhcp-port.
In this patch, during subnet deletion context is elevated to update
port.

Add unittests and fix exception for OpenContrail plugin.

Closes-bug: #1267310

Change-Id: I9dffba50480b2cbbcf3468657ec669230f62b96d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/24/122124/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use $((EXPRESSION)) instead of $[EXPRESSION]

$((EXPRESSION)) is POSIX-conform and should be preferred.

Change-Id: Ibd0524194aeda40961e202b6761dbaed2ea27dfa

commit_message:
block retrying 1.3.0

retrying 1.3.0 released ... without a requirements.txt even though
their setup.py thinks it should have one. They symptom is that glance
fails to install, and glance-manage doesn't exist.

Why pip install doesn't err early, will be a morning exercise.

Change-Id: Icd61ef2f33a250f0fcbcb583a1de46babb590a18
Fixes: the gate

revisions:

commit_message:
Update spec theme to show incubation status

Since zaqar is an incubation project, it should be using the
incubation option in oslosphinx.

Change-Id: I74aaa317cf5df97c2a6e2945b3b2e91b4b07a69b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-specs refs/changes/14/116314/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: html_theme_options = {'incubating': True}

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2014-10-01 06:00+0000\n"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/ch_pacemaker.xml:7(title)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/ch_pacemaker.xml:8(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/ch_pacemaker.xml:13(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/ch_pacemaker.xml:19(para) msgid "Pacemaker interacts with applications through resource agents (RAs), of which it supports over 70 natively. Pacemaker can also easily use third-party RAs. An OpenStack high-availability configuration uses existing native Pacemaker RAs (such as those managing MySQL databases or virtual IP addresses), existing third-party RAs (such as for RabbitMQ), and native OpenStack RAs (such as those managing the OpenStack Identity and Image Services)."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:7(title)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:8(para) msgid "Once the Corosync services have been started and you have established that the cluster is communicating properly, it is safe to start <systemitem class=\"service\">pacemakerd</systemitem>, the Pacemaker master control process:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:14(para) ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:14(para) msgid "<placeholder-1/> (LSB)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:19(para) ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:19(para) msgid "<placeholder-1/> (LSB, alternate)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:24(para) ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:24(para) msgid "<placeholder-1/> (upstart)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:29(para) ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:29(para) msgid "<placeholder-1/> (systemd)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_start_pacemaker.xml:34(para) msgid "Once Pacemaker services have started, Pacemaker will create a default empty cluster configuration with no resources. You may observe Pacemaker's status with the <placeholder-1/> utility:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:7(title)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:8(para) msgid "Besides installing the <package>corosync</package> package, you must also create a configuration file, stored in <filename>/etc/corosync/corosync.conf</filename>. Most distributions ship an example configuration file (<filename>corosync.conf.example</filename>) as part of the documentation bundled with the <package>corosync</package> package. An example Corosync configuration file is shown below:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:87(para) msgid "The <option>token</option> value specifies the time, in milliseconds, during which the Corosync token is expected to be transmitted around the ring. When this timeout expires, the token is declared lost, and after <option>token_retransmits_before_loss_const</option> lost tokens the non-responding processor (cluster node) is declared dead. In other words, <option>token</option>  <option>token_retransmits_before_loss_const</option> is the maximum time a node is allowed to not respond to cluster messages before being considered dead. The default for <option>token</option> is 1000 (1 second), with 4 allowed retransmits. These defaults are intended to minimize failover times, but can cause frequent \"false alarms\" and unintended failovers in case of short network interruptions. The values used here are safer, albeit with slightly extended failover times."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:103(para) msgid "With <option>secauth</option> enabled, Corosync nodes mutually authenticate using a 128-byte shared secret stored in <filename>/etc/corosync/authkey</filename>, which may be generated with the <placeholder-1/> utility. When using <option>secauth</option>, cluster communications are also encrypted."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:111(para) msgid "In Corosync configurations using redundant networking (with more than one <option>interface</option>), you must select a Redundant Ring Protocol (RRP) mode other than <literal>none</literal>. <literal>active</literal> is the recommended RRP mode."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:117(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:121(para) msgid "The <option>ringnumber</option> must differ between all configured interfaces, starting with 0."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:125(para) msgid "The <option>bindnetaddr</option> is the network address of the interfaces to bind to. The example uses two network addresses of <literal>/24</literal> IPv4 subnets." msgstr "" #: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:130(para) msgid "Multicast groups (<option>mcastaddr</option>) must not be reused across cluster boundaries. In other words, no two distinct clusters should ever use the same multicast group. Be sure to select multicast addresses compliant with <link href=\"http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2365.txt\">RFC 2365, \"Administratively Scoped IP Multicast\"</link>."msgid "For firewall configurations, note that Corosync communicates over UDP only, and uses <literal>mcastport</literal> (for receives) and <literal>mcastport - 1</literal> (for sends)."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:145(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_up_corosync.xml:152(para) msgid "Once created, the <filename>corosync.conf</filename> file (and the <filename>authkey</filename> file if the <option>secauth</option> option is enabled) must be synchronized across all cluster nodes."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:7(title)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:8(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:15(para) msgid "<package>pacemaker</package> (Note that the crm shell should be downloaded separately.)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:20(package)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:25(package)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:30(package)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:34(para) msgid "<package>fence-agents</package> (Fedora only; all other distributions use fencing agents from <package>cluster-glue</package>)"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_install_packages.xml:40(package)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_basic_cluster_properties.xml:8(para) msgid "Once your Pacemaker cluster is set up, it is recommended to set a few basic cluster properties. To do so, start the <placeholder-1/> shell and change into the configuration menu by entering <literal>configure</literal>. Alternatively, you may jump straight into the Pacemaker configuration menu by typing <placeholder-2/> directly from a shell prompt."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_basic_cluster_properties.xml:14(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_basic_cluster_properties.xml:22(para) msgid "Setting <option>no-quorum-policy=\"ignore\"</option> is required in 2-node Pacemaker clusters for the following reason: if quorum enforcement is enabled, and one of the two nodes fails, then the remaining node can not establish a majority of quorum votes necessary to run services, and thus it is unable to take over any resources. In this case, the appropriate workaround is to ignore loss of quorum in the cluster. This should only only be done in 2-node clusters: do not set this property in Pacemaker clusters with more than two nodes. Note that a two-node cluster with this setting exposes a risk of split-brain because either half of the cluster, or both, are able to become active in the event that both nodes remain online but lose communication with one another. The preferred configuration is 3 or more nodes per cluster."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_basic_cluster_properties.xml:37(para) msgid "Setting <option>pe-warn-series-max</option>, <option>pe-input-series-max</option> and <option>pe-error-series-max</option> to 1000 instructs Pacemaker to keep a longer history of the inputs processed, and errors and warnings generated, by its Policy Engine. This history is typically useful in case cluster troubleshooting becomes necessary."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_set_basic_cluster_properties.xml:45(para) msgid "Pacemaker uses an event-driven approach to cluster state processing. However, certain Pacemaker actions occur at a configurable interval, <option>cluster-recheck-interval</option>, which defaults to 15 minutes. It is usually prudent to reduce this to a shorter interval, such as 5 or 3 minutes."#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:8(para) msgid "Corosync is started as a regular system service. Depending on your distribution, it may ship with an LSB init script, an upstart job, or a systemd unit file. Either way, the service is usually named <systemitem class=\"service\">corosync</systemitem>:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:34(para)#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:35(para) msgid "The <placeholder-1/> utility, when invoked with the <option>-s</option> option, gives a summary of the health of the communication rings:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:47(para) msgid "The <placeholder-1/> utility can be used to dump the Corosync cluster member list:"#: ./doc/high-availability-guide/pacemaker/section_starting_corosync.xml:56(para)

commit_message:
Allow ceilometer-api to run under mod_wsgi

If CEILOMETER_USE_MOD_WSGI is True then the API app will
run under mod wsgi. The default is false (for now).

The changes are modeled on keystone's use of apache.

Note that these changes are dependent on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121823/ in ceilometer.

Using mod_wsgi allows the ceilometer api to handle "concurrent"
requests. This is extremely useful when trying to benchmark
various aspects of the service.

Change-Id: I4c220c3b52804cd8d9123b47780a98e0346ca81e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/121850/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Listen %PORT% <VirtualHost *:%PORT%> WSGIDaemonProcess ceilometer-api processes=2 threads=10 user=%USER% display-name=%{GROUP} WSGIProcessGroup ceilometer-api WSGIScriptAlias / %WSGIAPP% WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} %ERRORLOGFORMAT% ErrorLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/ceilometer.log CustomLog /var/log/%APACHE_NAME%/ceilometer_access.log combined </VirtualHost>

commit_message:
console: make websocketproxy handles token from path

As part of the blueprint serial-ports when connecting to
the proxy with a plain websocket, make Nova able to retrieve
the token from the request path.

Closes-Bug: #1373950
Change-Id: I0b0b23c954dbb812acfa7616696445c0e167d2c8

commit_message:
Making execution context immutable

* The idea of this commit is that mutable execution context
  doesn't make any sense in general because of variety of
  workflows we may have. So that, for example, if we have
  multiple parallel routes in a workflow graph then there
  can't be any shared context between them. There's only
  inbound and outbound context for a certain task.

  At the same time it turned to be convenient to leave
  immutable execution 'context' field that includes all
  the initial variables at the moment a workflow started
  (including OpenStack related data accessible via key
  'openstack' and information about  execution itself
  accessible via '__execution').

Change-Id: I0257a0952bb661a7ad2c44742584a02609c54fc3

commit_message:
Fix for volume detach error when use NFS as the cinder backend

For NFS volumes, every time you detach a volume, nova tries to umount
the device path. If the device path is busy (or in use), it should
output a message to log and continue.
In current code, if the device is busy, it cannot catch the device is busy
message returned by umount, because it looking for the target is busy.
 Therefore, current code skip the if statement and run the else and
raise the exception.
Fix: Add device is busy to if statement.

Add a mock test to check the behaviour of the
virt.libvirt.volume.LibvirtNFSVolumeDriver.disconnect_volume
when it has umount errors.

Closes-Bug: #1340552

Change-Id: Iac946c37064c5f5bf5a102305de40d21d16846c1

Exceptions `TestException` and `SSHError` from rally.exceptions is not 
used around whole project, so we don't need them and can decrease LOC. 

Change-Id: Ifb4d81c20f43ef77448a305f8c79b8f5007254d2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove two unused exceptions

Exceptions `TestException` and `SSHError` from rally.exceptions is not 
used around whole project, so we don't need them and can decrease LOC. 

Change-Id: Ifb4d81c20f43ef77448a305f8c79b8f5007254d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/68/125068/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable the swift logs env vars for all jobs

Provide SWIFT_logs_LOGSERVER_PREFIX etc for all jobs to allow
them to upload to the logs container if they are configured to.

Change-Id: If532c782c64e155cb8a0cbab6d661af3301a62a1

commit_message:
Make default creds for datasources admin

Congress is much more useful when it can see everything which requires
running as the admin user so this patch changes it to do so.

Change-Id: Ibabb33637ebbe16e6758b70dda06dc4839bcb425
Closes-bug: 1375431

commit_message:
VMware store: Re-use api session token

The store object is currently instanciated for each API call. The
constructor of the store object triggers the configuration of the
store. The session token to communicate with vCenter is generated
in this configuration step which can take some time depending on
the network.

This patch prevents the creation of the session throughout the API
calls.

Closes-Bug: #1350010

Change-Id: I5b77762328d9e7187b5be765b645b3fa54c28fd6

commit_message:
disable neutron network tests that fail too much

The neutron team has deferred addressing these issues until K1. They
are basically preventing any Icehouse code from landing on any project
due to the incredibly high failure rate.

Disable these tests until the neutron team can address the underlying
issue.

Change-Id: I1e5520f2a3aeaaa0dc0b70d307f902cd26be2b03
Related-Bug: #1323658
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/125150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make devstack script able to set password

devstack-gate runs with a custom password so we need to be able to
handle setting it so that our CI can start congress with the right
password.

Change-Id: Ib50ce878cf7f61c4b8f349b51b726ae65e6d9a96
closes-bug: 1375434
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/39/124839/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Update congress configuration file # Update congress datasource file # NOTE(arosen): congress datasource file does not use the same format as others # so we use sed instead of iniset. This will removed anyways onces congress can # configure datasources via the api. sed -i -e "s/password: password/username: $ADMIN_PASSWORD/g" $CONGRESS_DATASOURCE_FILE

commit_message:
Removes unused code from wsgi _to_xml_node

Removes support for metadata list_collections and dict_collections
as it is no longer used. Looks like it was last used in the previous
implementation of the Nova API framework (eg before the current V2 one)

Change-Id: I314b13816cdcf51f04926ca9eec67cac765cc893
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/124679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # Set the xml namespace if one is specified # TODO(justinsb): We could also use prefixes on the keys xmlns = metadata.get('xmlns', None) if xmlns: result.setAttribute('xmlns', xmlns) collections = metadata.get('list_collections', {}) if nodename in collections: metadata = collections[nodename] for item in data: node = doc.createElement(metadata['item_name']) node.setAttribute(metadata['item_key'], str(item)) result.appendChild(node) return result singular = metadata.get('plurals', {}).get(nodename, None) if singular is None: if nodename.endswith('s'): singular = nodename[:-1] else: singular = 'item' collections = metadata.get('dict_collections', {}) if nodename in collections: metadata = collections[nodename] for k, v in data.items(): node = doc.createElement(metadata['item_name']) node.setAttribute(metadata['item_key'], str(k)) text = doc.createTextNode(str(v)) node.appendChild(text) result.appendChild(node) return result

commit_message:
Use identity_uri instead of older fragments

This has been the default option in middleware for a while now and we
should recommend the default options.

Change-Id: Ief347c897cf15ab4101936a56404e3a378021b15

commit_message:
Add test for getting a token with inherited role

If a user has an inherited role in a domain, he
is able to get a token on every project inside
that domain, even if he doesn't have a specific
grant on that project.
This patch adds a test for this behavior.

Change-Id: Ib65cb3443559d3bb9b7ffc2b96237072d2b5be56
Closes-Bug: 1365147
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/06/119206/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_token_from_inherited_user_domain_role_grants(self): # Create a new user to ensure that no grant is loaded from sample data user = self.new_user_ref(domain_id=self.domain_id) password = user['password'] user = self.identity_api.create_user(user) user['password'] = password # Define domain and project authentication data domain_auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=user['id'], password=user['password'], domain_id=self.domain_id) project_auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=user['id'], password=user['password'], project_id=self.project_id) # Check the user cannot get a domain nor a project token self.v3_authenticate_token(domain_auth_data, expected_status=401) self.v3_authenticate_token(project_auth_data, expected_status=401) # Grant non-inherited role for user on domain non_inher_ud_url, non_inher_ud_entity = ( _build_role_assignment_url_and_entity( domain_id=self.domain_id, user_id=user['id'], role_id=self.role_id)) self.put(non_inher_ud_url) # Check the user can get only a domain token self.v3_authenticate_token(domain_auth_data) self.v3_authenticate_token(project_auth_data, expected_status=401) # Create inherited role inherited_role = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': 'inherited'} self.assignment_api.create_role(inherited_role['id'], inherited_role) # Grant inherited role for user on domain inher_ud_url, inher_ud_entity = _build_role_assignment_url_and_entity( domain_id=self.domain_id, user_id=user['id'], role_id=inherited_role['id'], inherited_to_projects=True) self.put(inher_ud_url) # Check the user can get both a domain and a project token self.v3_authenticate_token(domain_auth_data) self.v3_authenticate_token(project_auth_data) # Delete inherited grant self.delete(inher_ud_url) # Check the user can only get a domain token self.v3_authenticate_token(domain_auth_data) self.v3_authenticate_token(project_auth_data, expected_status=401) # Delete non-inherited grant self.delete(non_inher_ud_url) # Check the user cannot get a domain token anymore self.v3_authenticate_token(domain_auth_data, expected_status=401)

commit_message:
Don't register options in __init__

Each driver currently registers its own config options in the
constructor. This is not a good thing and has caused things like
`dynamic_conf` to happen.

This patch adds a method that is called in the constructor of the base
class that goes through the driver's options and registers them. The
method catches duplicated exceptions. We don't care about those for now
and we assume the driver consumer knows what it's doing.

Bug: #1372335
Change-Id: I3341416332a0e620e428308f463d1bb635927a5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/20/123720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _DRIVER_OPTIONS = options._config_options()
deleted_lines: opts = options.REDIS_OPTIONS if 'dynamic' in conf: names = conf[options.REDIS_GROUP].keys() opts = filter(lambda x: x.name not in names, opts) self.conf.register_opts(opts, group=options.REDIS_GROUP)

commit_message:
trove client HTTPClient __init__ fails if auth_url None

The initializer for the python-troveclient HTTPClient class
fails if passed a None for an auth_url.
This patch modifies the inializer to not call rstrip
if auth_url is None, matching the initalizers in
python-novaclient and python-neutronclient

Change-Id: I01fdf2dffe3c149edeaef66db6d047e462f985d9
Closes-bug: #1375982
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/95/125195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.auth_url = auth_url.rstrip('/') if auth_url else auth_url
