commit_message:
Use different timeouts for create and restore

Restoring an instance from a backup can take significantly longer than
just creating an instance. Introduce a new timeout for the restore case
with a higher default value

Change-Id: I44af03e9b2c966dd94fcfd0ff475f112ac21be5b
Closes-Bug: 1356645
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/77/123677/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timeout = (CONF.restore_usage_timeout if backup_info else CONF.usage_timeout) time_out=timeout) err = inst_models.InstanceTasks.BUILDING_ERROR_REPLICA

commit_message:
Workaround for 'File exists' test failure

Adds code to create the assets directory that django_pyscss
intends to create for scss.  This avoids throwing an exception
in concurrency scenarios

Change-Id: Ic55e2a7ce59ec9b7550a7412697cb8d6563d98a3
Closes-bug: #1367590

The original thought - to use the build to separately upload
config.json for our CORS draft build - didn't work because
of lack of path munging control. Instead we've declared a

Change-Id: I16ad8fd8b90aca93929e68ef3033715e0666795b
"}]
commit_message:
Call build:draft instead of build for js-draft build

The original thought - to use the build to separately upload
config.json for our CORS draft build - didn't work because
of lack of path munging control. Instead we've declared a
separate build target called 'build:draft' that compiles an
appropriate client, which can then be uploaded in one go.

Change-Id: I16ad8fd8b90aca93929e68ef3033715e0666795b

commit_message:
V1.1: Add id property to messages in claims

The id property should be also added to messages returned from the
claims endpoints: claim messages and get claim.

Change-Id: Ida02aa4e1c794adb3ae7ea26cdd250ae45cac5bd
Partially-implements: blueprint api-v1.1-response-document-changes

commit_message:
Add a test for deleting a suspended server

A server should be able to be deleted at any time.
This patch adds a test for deleting a suspended server.

Change-Id: I21ab4eb204f1d85ef53d239afc92fd6a3359a97e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/31/124931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.compute_feature_enabled.suspend, 'Suspend is not available.') @test.attr(type='gate') def test_delete_server_while_in_suspended_state(self): # Delete a server while it's VM state is Suspended _, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') self.client.suspend_server(server['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'SUSPENDED') resp, _ = self.client.delete_server(server['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) self.client.wait_for_server_termination(server['id'])

commit_message:
Make the replication snapshot timeout configurable

There is no way to tell how long the snapshot for replication
will take, and we have no good way to poll for the slave state.
Eventually, we will need to have an intelligent poll (perhaps
based on guest heartbeats), but in the meantime we will have
the the snapshot use a configurable timeout which can be set
as needed, and independently of the agent_call timeouts.

Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6316d748e91d1ec3eebe25a14bb43fbfe10db669
Closes-bug: 1362310

deleted_lines: if time_out is not None and time.time() > start_time + time_out:

subject: Do not run fwaas API tests in smoke
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-18 16:42:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_fwaas_extensions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5bdcc77e0bb6a1e6085c5348664d8a398e4c11c0', 'message': 'Do not run fwaas API tests in smoke

Now that we are running full tempest against neutron, and because fwaas
is not part of core functionality (and not fully baked). Remove these
test from smoke as part of the effort to only test advanced services
against neutron and not against all projects.

commit_message:
Do not run fwaas API tests in smoke

Now that we are running full tempest against neutron, and because fwaas
is not part of core functionality (and not fully baked). Remove these
test from smoke as part of the effort to only test advanced services
against neutron and not against all projects.

Related patch: Ib315d30ff3c4463203f7ebe00e159a9680cf1616

Change-Id: I2e0ce9641becabbeed5f6ad82ad478d84a37f36f

commit_message:
Add python-keystoneclient-federation to the Identity program

Similar to the python-keystoneclient-kerberos auth plugin, the federation
auth plugin for keystoneclient requires external dependencies that should
not be required for all installations of keystoneclient. Therefore this
plugin has been added as a separate repository and package (on pypi).

Change-Id: I8e6ba4d8ef41dce84748574956fba485ec79919b

commit_message:
Add spec for env-data-lookup HOT intrinsic function

blueprint env-data-lookup

Change-Id: Ieb28d8115cb92833bc11216ceb356ffe04be832c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/06/117806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================================== env_data_lookup intrinsic function for HOT ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/env-data-lookup Heat should provide a way for end-users to look up values from custom mappings. Problem description =================== OpenStack operators might adopt a workflow where Glance image names are aliased to a specific UUID, and then when a new release of that image is ready, the name is re-aliased to a new UUID. The original image UUID will continue to be available. For example:: a665e593-0473-4276-b83f-86d70d399422 <- "CentOS 6.4" Then after a new release:: 37af28c0-427b-4ddb-b46c-bf4d085fc63d <- "CentOS 6.4" a665e593-0473-4276-b83f-86d70d399422 As a Heat end-user, it may be necessary to test each template and validate that it works with a specific version of an image. If the Heat template refers to images by name, the tests will become invalid everytime a new version of the image is released. This can be avoided by referring to images by UUID. However, if the templates are being rendered in a UI, the image choices will be shown as UUIDs instead of names. This is unacceptable from the template end-user's perspective, since they won't immediately know which distribution is available in the drop-down menu by looking at the UUIDs. Proposed change =============== The env_data_lookup function will allow look up of a value from a "data" section in the environment. The "data" section will contain a list of mappings. For example:: mappings: images: CentOS 6.4: a665e593-0473-4276-b83f-86d70d399422 If the name being looked up is not available, then the name itself will be returned. For example, with the above environment, find_in_map will return "Ubuntu 12.04":: { find_in_map: [ images, Ubuntu 12.04 ] } This will allow Heat users to pin a specific Glance image name to a specific glance image UUID and ensure that their tests remain valid, while providing the most user-friendly experience to the template users. Alternatives ------------ A "mappings" template section and "find_in_env" intrinsic function for HOT was proposed (analogous to the CFN section/function). It was poorly received because it reduces template portability between clouds. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jason Dunsmore Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-3 Work Items ---------- * Add support for a "data" section in the environment * Add a "env_data_lookup" HOT intrinsic function * Add a usage example to the template guide doc Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Ensure tempest writes a full manifest

The tempest element uses pip install after generating the manifest,
meaning that it installs software not listed in its manifest.

Fix it so that it writes the manifest after the last of these
installs.

Change-Id: I456d650c0bcba448cb18efad95e7daeccd5d9e0b

commit_message:
Don't use keystone client before initializing it

Eventlet was calling poll() before the KeystoneDriver finished, so the the
keystone client object was not initialized yet.  This caused an AttributeError
in KeystoneDriver.  This change separates the KeystoneDriver constructor from
initialization of the keystone client object.  This separation ensures that
the first time eventlet calls update_from_datasource(), the KeystoneDriver is
fully initialized.

Change-Id: I55f76d5dc115920ea04d0a954919d9ef329fb886

Add DEPLOYMENT_MODE to local_settings.py

DEPLOYMENT_MODE determine if we do flavor matching, it can be "poc" (No) or "scale" (Yes).
This is used in Tuskar-ui to show flavor administration options etc.

commit_message:
Recommendation to Adopt DCO as CLA

At its July 2014 meeting, the OpenStack Foundation Board of Directors
heard information about the impact and options to address the
OpenStack Contributor License Agreement.  One of the questions raised
was whether the issues being brought forward were simply the opinion
of one member of the Board.

This resolution clarifies that the TC believes that the current CLA is
problematic and the DCO should be considered instead.

Change-Id: I5da90bd9ae3c7c08c028aa8dd3d0521b8b44d593
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/60/120260/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================================== 2014-09-09 Recommendation to Adopt DCO as CLA =============================================== The OpenStack Technical Committee, representing the developer community, requests that the Board of Directors consider implementing the Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO) as the Contributor License Agreement (CLA) for the OpenStack project. The current CLA is a barrier to contributions from new developers because it is a unique and unfamiliar legal document that must be reviewed. Many developers are uncertain as to what its provisions actually are. Instead, most developers would be far more comfortable with the common understanding provided by the well-known Apache License (whose provisions are understood by developers and corporate counsels alike). As the OpenStack project grows, we need to continually recruit new developers to the project as well as convince new users that they will be able to contribute. The current CLA is a warning flag to serious open source developers that the project does not operate in the way they expect an open source project to work, and it makes it more difficult for users to contribute simple fixes easily. The need for the project and its contributors to understand and agree upon the terms under which contributions are made is important. The DCO accomplishes that by indicating that developers are responsible for the code that they contribute and that they understand that the contribution is under the terms of the Apache License. This simple process is familiar to developers and legal counsels and is all that is required for the licensing needs of OpenStack.

commit_message:
Use devstack's new way of doing things

Recent commits in devstack introduce shinny new helper functions. Let's
use them.

run_process() introduced in Ia3843818014f7c6c7526ef3aa9676bbddb8a85ca

configure_auth_token_middleware() introduced in
I3b6727d5a3bdc0ca600d8faa23bc6db32bb32260

Change-Id: Id8c3f71c98c7582f6f0c5ef589396af741958484

commit_message:
Set iboot_relay_id and iboot_port

When register-nodes, Optional parameters of iboot_relay_id and iboot_port
were not set correctly. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I7246f026102d1cf434405b78fc2a5911a4cac91a
Closes-Bug: #1370304

commit_message:
Detect if a node is being reused

Drop a file into the logs directory containing job details, if we find
it already existed this means the node has already been used.

Change-Id: If8151756c8273b57bdbda8e02917210081a8f97c
Related-Bug: #1370275
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/18/122018/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create the logs dir and place a file in it with a unique name # we can later use this to test if nodes are being reused bug 1370275 mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/logs/ if $WORKSPACE/logs/unique-* ; then echo "This node was used already" exit 1 else touch $WORKSPACE/logs/unique-$(uuidgen -r) fi

commit_message:
Switch to new setup-neutron

Switch to the new setup-neutron provided by os-cloud-config, and to
ease developer (and git) confusion, remove and ignore the old
setup-neutron script.

Change-Id: Iec4cad877f3583bd37222fa87c25a1503e7ba516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/01/117401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Setup neutron for a new cloud. # # Assumes an OpenStack rc file has been sourced already to provide credentials # and endpoint information. set -eu set -o pipefail # Future work: # Make this take options # or perhaps eliminate it and describe it as raw commands in incubator. # Start of DHCP range ALLOCATION_START=$1 # End of DHCP range ALLOCATION_END=$2 # Network CIDR NETWORK_CIDR=$3 # Where to route traffic NETWORK_GATEWAY=$4 # Where the metadata service is - ideally nova-bm would manage this: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1239481 METADATA_SERVER=$5 # If non-empty create a provider flat network with this name otherwise create a # virtual network and setup a router etc. PHYSICAL_NETWORK=${6:-""} # Start of floating range FLOATING_START=${7:-""} # End of floating range FLOATING_END=${8:-""} # Floating CIDR FLOATING_CIDR=${9:-""} # Create command line parameters if [ -n "$ALLOCATION_START" -a -n "$ALLOCATION_END" ] ; then ALLOCATION_POOL="start=${ALLOCATION_START},end=${ALLOCATION_END}" fi # Find the admin tenant. TENANT_ID=$(keystone tenant-list | grep ' admin ' | awk '{print $2}') if [ -n "$PHYSICAL_NETWORK" ] ; then # Underclouds NET_NAME=$PHYSICAL_NETWORK NET_EXTRA="--tenant_id $TENANT_ID --provider:network_type flat --provider:physical_network $PHYSICAL_NETWORK" SUBNET_EXTRA="--tenant_id $TENANT_ID --host_routes type=dict list=true destination=169.254.169.254/32,nexthop=$METADATA_SERVER" else # Overclouds NET_NAME="default-net" NET_EXTRA="--shared" SUBNET_EXTRA="--dns-nameservers list=true 8.8.8.8" fi NET_ID=$(neutron net-create $NET_NAME $NET_EXTRA | grep ' id ' | awk '{print $4}') SUBNET_ID=$(neutron subnet-create --ip_version 4 ${ALLOCATION_POOL:+--allocation-pool $ALLOCATION_POOL} ${NETWORK_GATEWAY:+--gateway $NETWORK_GATEWAY} $NET_ID $NETWORK_CIDR $SUBNET_EXTRA | grep ' id ' | awk '{print $4}') if [ -z "$PHYSICAL_NETWORK" ] ; then neutron router-create default-router neutron router-interface-add default-router $SUBNET_ID fi if [ -n "$FLOATING_START" -a -n "$FLOATING_END" -a -n "$FLOATING_CIDR" ] ; then neutron net-create ext-net --router:external=True SUBNET_ID=$(neutron subnet-create ext-net $FLOATING_CIDR --disable-dhcp \ --allocation-pool start=$FLOATING_START,end=$FLOATING_END) neutron router-gateway-set default-router ext-net fi

commit_message:
Add more checks for zuul/layout.yaml

Check that each project (with exception of z/tempest) has a merge-check
template.
Check projects - so far stackforge only - for alphabetical order.

The merge template check is taken from a test that Jeremy shared.

Change-Id: I2bc457ddfe0eca787bb88ceeb919f89d491978d7
Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>

commit_message:
Fix resource cleanup in server rescue tests

If server rescue tests are skipped then the resource cleanup method
terminates with AttributeError: type object has no attribute 'volume'.
The fix checks whether volume exist before operating with it.

Change-Id: I6ae7f7bb2ba73313db676bafd597c0934704959a

commit_message:
javelin: Detach the volume before destruction

In Icehouse, a volume needs to be detached before it can be deleted.

Closes-Bug:  #1375476

Change-Id: Ic1c8e79fc1efa46ac9a70e288166cd5e0d823cfa

Open Kilo development

Bump pre-version to 2015.1 to formally open master branch to Kilo
development.

commit_message:
Group stackforge projects in layout.yaml

Move all stackforge projects in the stackforge section, move
non-stackforge projects out of the section.
Sort stackforge project list alphabetically.

Change-Id: Ie845c1d450f102ca31f582a54f106c5e432db8e9

commit_message:
Use tox -e zuul for layout test

Adjust tox environment, the check_projects_yaml_alphabetized.sh script
only works with gerrit/projects.yaml but not with layout.yaml, so remove
the call.

Change the job to use tox -e zuul.

Change-Id: I70d918ec1de94c6ec9aa0c2c6647aa8c791df303

added_lines: from fuelweb_test.helpers.common import Common groups=["simple_flat_create_instance"]) @log_snapshot_on_error def simple_flat_create_instance(self): """Create instance with file injection Scenario: 1. Revert "simple flat" environment 2. Create instance with file injection 3. Assert instance was created """ #self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_simple_flat") data = { 'tenant': 'novaSimpleFlat', 'user': 'novaSimpleFlat', 'password': 'novaSimpleFlat' } controller = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name('slave-01') common_func = Common(controller['ip'], data['user'], data['password'], data['tenant']) remote = self.env.get_ssh_to_remote_by_name('slave-01') remote.execute("echo 'Hello World' > /root/test.txt") server_files = {"/root/test.txt": 'Hello World'} instance = common_func.create_instance(file=server_files) wait(lambda: common_func.get_instance_detail(instance).status == 'ACTIVE', timeout=10 * 60) common_func.verify_instance_status(instance, 'ACTIVE') @test(depends_on=[deploy_simple_flat],

commit_message:
WIP - Alarmed metrics API changes
- Changed alarms resource to alarm-definitions
- Added new alarms resource that tracks alarm/metric associations

Change-Id: Ib660eabd2c34001d165bf22bc9941b6a1cb4fcef

added_lines: /* * Copyright (c) 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except * in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License * is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express * or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under * the License. */ package com.hpcloud.mon.domain.model.alarmdefinition; import java.util.Collections; import java.util.List; import javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlElement; import javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlRootElement; import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore; import com.hpcloud.mon.common.model.alarm.AlarmExpression; import com.hpcloud.mon.domain.common.AbstractEntity; import com.hpcloud.mon.domain.model.common.Link; import com.hpcloud.mon.domain.model.common.Linked; import com.wordnik.swagger.annotations.ApiModel; import com.wordnik.swagger.annotations.ApiModelProperty; @ApiModel(value = "Defines an alarm") @XmlRootElement(name = "Alarm definition") public class AlarmDefinition extends AbstractEntity implements Linked { private List<Link> links; private String name; private String description = ""; private String expression; private Object expressionData; private List<String> matchBy; private String severity; private boolean actionsEnabled; private List<String> alarmActions; private List<String> okActions; private List<String> undeterminedActions; public AlarmDefinition() {} public AlarmDefinition(String id, String name, String description, String severity, String expression, List<String> matchBy, boolean actionsEnabled, List<String> alarmActions, List<String> okActions, List<String> undeterminedActions) { this.id = id; this.name = name; setDescription(description); setSeverity(severity); setExpression(expression); setMatchBy(matchBy); setActionsEnabled(actionsEnabled); setAlarmActions(alarmActions); setOkActions(okActions); setUndeterminedActions(undeterminedActions); } @Override public boolean equals(Object obj) { if (this == obj) return true; if (!super.equals(obj)) return false; if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false; AlarmDefinition other = (AlarmDefinition) obj; if (actionsEnabled != other.actionsEnabled) return false; if (alarmActions == null) { if (other.alarmActions != null) return false; } else if (!alarmActions.equals(other.alarmActions)) return false; if (description == null) { if (other.description != null) return false; } else if (!description.equals(other.description)) return false; if (expression == null) { if (other.expression != null) return false; } else if (!expression.equals(other.expression)) return false; if (expressionData == null) { if (other.expressionData != null) return false; } else if (!expressionData.equals(other.expressionData)) return false; if (links == null) { if (other.links != null) return false; } else if (!links.equals(other.links)) return false; if (matchBy == null) { if (other.matchBy != null) return false; } else if (!matchBy.equals(other.matchBy)) return false; if (name == null) { if (other.name != null) return false; } else if (!name.equals(other.name)) return false; if (okActions == null) { if (other.okActions != null) return false; } else if (!okActions.equals(other.okActions)) return false; Closes-Bug: 1316234

commit_message:
Add a new non-blocking delete option for images

Currently images can be deleted immediately with a blocking call or marked as
'pending_delete' and deleted in the future by a scrubber. This patch adds a
third configurable option to delete images immediately in the background.

Change-Id: I043c6743ef34cd4e70657c73f7bded0ae51ba335
Closes-Bug: 1316234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/59/118459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_image_location_from_backend_non_block(context, image_id, location): """ Given a location, begin deletion of image in the background and return immediately. :param context: The request context :param image_id: The image identifier :param location: The image location entry """ # TODO(jesse): spawn a thread or subprocess to delete the image pass if CONF.non_blocking_delete: deleted = delete_image_location_from_backend_non_block(context, image_id, location, )

commit_message:
Adds to KMIP secret store test coverage

Adds a few small changes to make the KMIP Secret Store plugin more
robust, along with unit tests that raise the kmip_secret_store test
coverage to 100% (once pykmip is added test-requirements.txt)

Change-Id: Id3772e05e269a8d96c7205ade49d429e5fc0b50f

commit_message:
Tune up mod_wsgi settings in example configuration

Explicitly set mod-wsgi process-group to ceilometer-api in sample
This gives the process a good name in process listings.

Set number of process and threads to two and ten respectively. This
represents a reasonable setting to achieve moderate levels of
concurrency.

Change-Id: Iada6126cb525d597cc385c2d63e6228ef08d55a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/19/121919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WSGIDaemonProcess ceilometer-api user=vagrant group=vagrant processes=2 threads=10 WSGIProcessGroup ceilometer-api</VirtualHost>
deleted_lines: WSGIDaemonProcess ceilometer user=vagrant group=vagrant threads=5 WSGIProcessGroup ceilometer</VirtualHost>

commit_message:
Use oslo.msg retry API in rpc publisher

This patch removes the ceilometer hack around rabbitmq configuration
to use the oslo.messaging API to retry rpc connection.

Closes bug #1244698
Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: I162f2ce7ba7f6644d995dfeef8b0ef5e2727c226
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/45/77845/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.policy in ['default', 'queue', 'drop']: retry = None if self.policy in ['queue', 'drop']: retry = 1 self.rpc_client = messaging.get_rpc_client(retry=retry, version='1.0') except oslo.messaging.MessagingDisconnected:
deleted_lines: import oslo.messaging._drivers.commondef oslo_messaging_is_rabbit(): kombu = ['ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu', 'oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit:RabbitDriver' 'rabbit'] return cfg.CONF.rpc_backend in kombu or ( cfg.CONF.transport_url and cfg.CONF.transport_url.startswith('rabbit://')) def override_backend_retry_config(value): """Override the retry config option native to the configured rpc backend (if such a native config option exists). :param value: the value to override """ # TODO(sileht): ultimately we should add to olso a more generic concept # of retry config (i.e. not specific to an individual AMQP provider) # see: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1244698 # and: https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1282639 if oslo_messaging_is_rabbit(): if 'rabbit_max_retries' in cfg.CONF: cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_max_retries', value) if self.policy in ['queue', 'drop']: LOG.info(_('Publishing policy set to %s, \ override backend retry config to 1') % self.policy) override_backend_retry_config(1) elif self.policy == 'default': self.rpc_client = messaging.get_rpc_client(version='1.0') #note(sileht): # the behavior of rpc.cast call depends of rabbit_max_retries # if rabbit_max_retries <= 0: # it returns only if the msg has been sent on the amqp queue # if rabbit_max_retries > 0: # it raises a exception if rabbitmq is unreachable # # the default policy just respect the rabbitmq configuration # nothing special is done if rabbit_max_retries <= 0 # and exception is reraised if rabbit_max_retries > 0 except oslo.messaging._drivers.common.RPCException:

subject: Spec for immediate non-blocking image deletes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 20:04:52.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/immediate-non-blocking-image-delete.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/fd27e01d2002c7bf2aa6df1aeee6236eb7eb5af9', 'message': 'Spec for immediate non-blocking image deletes

bp immediate-non-blocking-image-delete

Change-Id: I0ec2fd84acaa5a814b82c422bacf2abd6245a6dc
'}]
commit_message:
Spec for immediate non-blocking image deletes

bp immediate-non-blocking-image-delete

Change-Id: I0ec2fd84acaa5a814b82c422bacf2abd6245a6dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/39/123239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Immediate Non-Blocking Image Delete =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/immediate-non-blocking-image-delete Currently images can be deleted immediately with a blocking call or marked as 'pending_delete' and deleted in the future by a scrubber. This patch adds a third configurable option to delete images immediately in the background. Problem description =================== As a public cloud user I would like my image deletes to happen immediately so that I am not billed for resources I no longer require. As a public cloud user I would like image delete requests to provide immediate feedback so I don't have to wait on a request. As a public cloud user I would like response times to be consistent so I know what to expect when using the cloud. Proposed change =============== Currently, there are two configurable options for deleting images: blocking delete calls and marking images to be scrubbed at a scheduled time. The former does not provide immediate feedback to the users. The later could result in a user being billed longer than necessary. It could also result in slowdowns due to a large number of delete requests all occurring at a scheduled time. This blueprint proposes a third configurable option: deleting images immediately with a non-blocking delete. Alternatives ------------ * The image scrubber could delete images over time instead of all at a scheduled time. Additionally, billing could be terminated upon request instead of upon delete. However, this still suffers from the problem of images not being deleted as soon as possible. The image scrubber seems best suited for private cloud users. Data model impact ----------------- An additional state should be added (i.e. delete_in_progress). However, it is not strictly required. When non_blocking_delete is enabled and an image delete is requested, an image would move to delete_in_progress. When the image is successfully deleted the image will move to deleted. This would happen within a single context. This state would only be used by operators to see the number of deletes that were currently in progress and to aid in troubleshooting deletes that failed while in progress. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- More responsive delete requests. Performance Impact ------------------ Same as blocking option. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jesse-j-cook Other contributors: nikhil-komawar Work Items ---------- * Add new state * Update code to support new configurable option Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Ensure state transitions occur as expected * Ensure deletes begin immediately, do not block, and complete successfully * Ensure billing notifications are sent correctly Documentation Impact ==================== * Document new configuration option for image deletes. * Document new state. References ========== https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1316234 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/118459/

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated). Our puppet-lint
jobs use the Modulefile to determine module name; this patch keep the

commit_message:
macros: Manage metadata.json file in puppet-lint jobs

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated). Our puppet-lint
jobs use the Modulefile to determine module name; this patch keep the 
retro-compat.  with Modulefile, but fetch the module name in
metadata.json file if available.

Change-Id: I1738ee14706d136837b2c8fe4ffa741907291bb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/69/124569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f Modulefile -o -f metadata.json ]; then if [ -f Modulefile ]; then MODULE=$(awk '/^name/ {print $NF}' Modulefile |tr -d \"\') elif [ -f metadata.json ]; then MODULE=$(python -c 'import json;print json.load(open("metadata.json"))["name"]') fi echo "Module name not defined in Modulefile or metadata.json"
deleted_lines: if [ -f Modulefile ]; then MODULE=$(awk '/^name/ {print $NF}' Modulefile |tr -d \"\') echo "Module name not defined in Modulefile"

commit_message:
Move python33 test for Keystone to experimental

py33 tests are not functional at the moment for Keystone, instead
of strictly non-voting, move it to experimental so it can be triggered
when someone is working on py33 compatibility, not on every check.

Change-Id: Ie9a8ed131f3c0338dead7e3a5c8da0fcc89add58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/63/124563/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - gate-keystone-python33

commit_message:
Promote sideways ironic grenade tests to non-voting checks

The ironic sideways grenade tests are no functional and passing.
This moves it out of experimental and promotes it to a non-voting
check job on the relevant projects.

Change-Id: Ia44831955e6e921424278c5f342b961efa9d772a

Move notifications for pycadf from oslo to keystone

The keystone team has taken over maintenance of the pycadf library. Move
notifications for changes in that repository from the oslo channel to
the keystone channel.

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated TESTR_FULL option

The TESTR_FULL option was added back when tempest was running by
default with nosestests serially to test using testr in parallel.
However, this migration happened >1yr ago and the testr-full job is
just a duplicate of the regular full now. This commit removes all uses
of it from job definitions.

Change-Id: I8af1b4bc0623e89786b34359c6e75aacb21b91ab

commit_message:
Fix indentation in rally-designate job config

Builder's parameters should not be on the same level as builder.
Otherwise bash script will be generated with errors.

commit_message:
Use ConfigFilter for opts

This will prevent them being registered on the global config object
and becoming available to consuming applications.

Change-Id: Ibddb876d18c6aefef9dca08cf5883d8bdca17925

subject: Make lockutils main() a console entry point
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 17:33:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency/commit/fde76b426ef4e79429b95b455889321d884dc302', 'message': 'Make lockutils main() a console entry point

This is more lib-ish than calling python -m on the module.

Change-Id: I6c35b5409bf567767c5c71b9041dd7f7a012255d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-26 21:12:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency/commit/d102d8f4194456838888302936a2b169159183ad', 'message': "Make lockutils main() a console entry point

This is more lib-ish than calling python -m on the module.

As part of this change, I also improved the unit tests for this code.
Before we weren't unsetting OSLO_LOCK_PATH before calling the main
function, so we had no way of knowing if it was being set correctly.

I also added a test case to verify return value propagation and
removed a private method that was never called.

Change-Id: I6c35b5409bf567767c5c71b9041dd7f7a012255d
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-29 16:55:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency/commit/78cf7e6df4684e963a02990be5bf15711f126ec1', 'message': "Make lockutils main() a console entry point

This is more lib-ish than calling python -m on the module.

As part of this change, I also improved the unit tests for this code.
Before we weren't unsetting OSLO_LOCK_PATH before calling the main
function, so we had no way of knowing if it was being set correctly.

I also added a test case to verify return value propagation and

commit_message:
Make lockutils main() a console entry point

This is more lib-ish than calling python -m on the module.

As part of this change, I also improved the unit tests for this code.
Before we weren't unsetting OSLO_LOCK_PATH before calling the main
function, so we had no way of knowing if it was being set correctly.

I also added a test case to verify return value propagation and
removed a private method that was never called.

Change-Id: I6c35b5409bf567767c5c71b9041dd7f7a012255d

commit_message:
Expose lockutils opts to config generator

* Adds an opts module for the config generator to use.
* Makes the opts in lockutils private since we don't want consumers
  using them directly.
* Moves the options to an oslo_concurrency group with appropriate
  deprecated_group settings to keep existing configs working.

Change-Id: Ifdb4d99e27588e8a91d941c60b248ea526c06e0a

added_lines: [entry_points] oslo.config.opts = oslo.concurrency = oslo.concurrency.opts:list_opts

commit_message:
IBM Storwize driver: Retype the volume with correct empty QoS

* Currently for Storwzie driver, if the new type does not have QoS
configurations, the old QoS configurations remain in the volume after
retyping it. It should be retyped into a volume with empty QoS for the
Storwize driver.
* Refactor three dicts into one for better maintainance of the QoS keys
for Storwize driver.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2b2801a4ef72ef02c11392ed00b56f5263a8a7e4
Closes-Bug: #1368595

commit_message:
Migrate scenario utils to tempest client

All scenario tests have been migrated to tempest client.
Migrate scenario utils as well, so that we may drop
the OfficialClientManager completely.

Change-Id: I3ec80de961ba289734f9bc811e4789e7d1b5903c
Partially-implements: bp/tempest-client-scenarios

commit_message:
Run a shell script instead of tox for osc functional

Currently, when running functional tests for OSC, we try to run
a tox job. It automatically fails because the user running tox does
not have sufficient permission to run the tests.

Suggest just running a single script file that OSC maintains, rather
than having to change infra resources every time something changes.

Change to add functional tests for OSC is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122605/

Change-Id: I8543db1c2ecbb6f78eb831ebc9ea1a03625e3542

heat-dsvm-functional INSTALL_TESTONLY=1

This change should fix the job check-heat-dsvm-functional

commit_message:
Enable retry tests on comment

One CI feature that Solum should provide is to
allow a user retry tests by commenting with
a particular phrase on the repo, just like
'recheck no bug' for OpenStack. This patch
enables this feature.

Change-Id: If1664410c485fad1289ede3511372ce65d9333f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/49/121249/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Fixes logging in image_import's main module

Some of the logs were not translated. This patch fixes those and
some other logs.

commit_message:
Skip validation if depends on not created resource

Using references on resources defined in template may be cause
of error during validation. This fix checks reference on another
resource and skips validation if resource is in INIT state.

Change-Id: I95531a1603de1e8c4b9f0f4b05b62eebc48beb3c
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1347571
Closes-Bug: #1339942

commit_message:
Fix subnet residue when resource deletion

Should set resource_id immediately after creating subnet
successful, otherwise the subnet resource will residue
when deletion.

Change-Id: I7974272d6a4b394775d971e2636bd1d4d5b78562
Closes-bug: #1370973

subject: Configure pci_passthrough_whitelist and pci_alias
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-23 22:43:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/43a6b292edcddcbb21643a7712a1261ea59738bc', 'message': 'Configure pci_passthrough_whitelist and pci_alias

This patch adds configuration of pci_passthrough_whitelist and
pci_alias in the nova configuration file. Define either of them as a
shell array. Parenthesis can be omitted if a single item is contained
in the array. Each item in the array is a Json docstring that defines
a dictionary, and therefore needs to be quoted.

Use the variable PCI_WHITELIST to define pci passthrough whitelists.
Supported keys for each item are "vendor_id", "product_id", "address"
or "devname", "physical_network". The keys and the values must be
quoted.

Use the variable PCI_ALIAS to define pci aliases. Supported keys are
"vendor_id", "product_id" and "physical_network". The keys and the
values must be quoted.

Examples:

PCI_WHITELIST=('{"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071","address":"*:0a:00.*","physical_network":"physnet1"}'
               '{"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}')

PCI_ALIAS='{"name":"cisco","vendor_id":"8086","product_id":"10ed"}'

Change-Id: I0d2fc2b7c6010fd6ce3d4ec837828091bfafbb18
Closes-Bug: #1373127

commit_message:
Configure pci_passthrough_whitelist and pci_alias

This patch adds configuration of pci_passthrough_whitelist and
pci_alias in the nova configuration file. Define either of them as a
shell array. Parenthesis can be omitted if a single item is contained
in the array. Each item in the array is a Json docstring that defines
a dictionary, and therefore needs to be quoted.

Use the variable PCI_WHITELIST to define pci passthrough whitelists.
Supported keys for each item are "vendor_id", "product_id", "address"
or "devname", "physical_network".

Use the variable PCI_ALIAS to define pci aliases. Supported keys are
"vendor_id", "product_id" and "physical_network".

The keys and the values must be quoted. Use ',' in between the key
value paires, and no space should be used.

Examples:

PCI_WHITELIST=('{"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071","address":"*:0a:00.*","physical_network":"physnet1"}'
               '{"vendor_id":"1137","product_id":"0071"}')

PCI_ALIAS='{"name":"cisco","vendor_id":"8086","product_id":"10ed"}'

Change-Id: I0d2fc2b7c6010fd6ce3d4ec837828091bfafbb18
Closes-Bug: #1373127
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/123599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$PCI_WHITELIST" ]; then iniset_multiline $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT pci_passthrough_whitelist ${PCI_WHITELIST[@]} fi fi if is_service_enabled n-cpu || is_service_enabled n-api; then if [ -n 'PCI_ALIAS' ]; then iniset_multiline $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT pci_alias ${PCI_ALIAS[@]} fi

commit_message:
Ensure that keystone uses global debug setting

When setting ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL the keystone screen would ignore
this setting and always use the debug mode.

Change-Id: I934443c2976e936198fc93da4cca717e6cb84e6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/59/123959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF DEFAULT debug $ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL EXTRA_PARAMS="" if [ "$ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL" == "True" ]; then EXTRA_PARAMS="--debug" fi run_process key "$KEYSTONE_DIR/bin/keystone-all --config-file $KEYSTONE_CONF $EXTRA_PARAMS"

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/barbican/ should thus be the incubated
branding.

commit_message:
Allowing all content-types for secret delete

Fixing issue where a secret delete fails if the Accept header
is set to application/json.

Change-Id: Ia60ec76805e7a820578f202ffa06c31579a084db
Closes-Bug: #1326481
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/55/124555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('barbican.plugin.resources.delete_secret') def test_should_delete_with_accept_header_application_json(self, mocked): """Covers Launchpad Bug: 1326481.""" self.app.delete( '/secrets/{0}/'.format(self.secret.id), headers={'Accept': 'application/json'} ) mocked.assert_called_once_with(self.secret, self.keystone_id, mock.ANY)

commit_message:
Adding size limits for create secret json fields

Setting maxLength for name, algorithm, mode, expiration,
payload_content_type, and payload_content_encoding fields.

Payload size is already validated through other means.

Change-Id: Id48c5ca9e7af6e8a49591787a58427255eee10b7
Closes-Bug: #1335327

commit_message:
Refactor secret functional tests using models and behaviors

Updated the functional tests to use models and behaviors for secrets.
* Adding simple HATEOS-compatible rest client
* Fixing model de/serialization
* Modifying all tests to conform to the new client
* Adding option to load tempest config from local etc
* Incorporating review feedback

Change-Id: I497b4f7bf10a9f47ca399b569d964762505466c9

commit_message:
Fix up tests after repo reorganization

Fix the default tox configuration so it works properly if a developer
just runs "tox" on their local system by removing environments from the
default list that do not exist. Add the jjb environment to the list.

Add the missing argument to check_projects_yaml_alphabetized.sh and
remove the unused arguments from run-layout.sh.

Exclude the .test directory created by the zuul test environment from
the files checked by flake8.

Change-Id: I72cb9aa3908d16f9e5b6d6445b07819563ce9104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/59/124759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = pep8,projects,jjbexclude = .tox,.test {toxinidir}/tools/check_projects_yaml_alphabetized.sh jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml {toxinidir}/tools/run-layout.sh

commit_message:
Remove oslotest cross-project unit test jobs

Remove the jobs that run the unit tests for projects that consume
oslotest. We don't need to gate every change on these tests.

Change-Id: I78ebee3017ce0c36645eceb5a40dc6b9bef54ce8

subject: Do not run unit test jobs for oslo-specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 21:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/ce94851a274ad7303b8c5a9c1d8c129bda5fc67b', 'message': 'Do not run unit test jobs for oslo-specs

Some of the specs repositories use the unit test job to validate the
contents of the spec file. We do not do that in oslo-specs, so there is
no point in running the job.

Change-Id: I5c2f16097cca5afdd03ba5cac85aa5d5489fd42b
'}]
commit_message:
Do not run unit test jobs for oslo-specs

Some of the specs repositories use the unit test job to validate the
contents of the spec file. We do not do that in oslo-specs, so there is
no point in running the job.

Change-Id: I5c2f16097cca5afdd03ba5cac85aa5d5489fd42b

added_lines: import binasciiimport structone_phase_create_data_plaintext = { "name": "AES key", "expiration": "2018-02-28T19:14:44.180394", "algorithm": "aes", "bit_length": 256, "mode": "cbc", "payload": "---SuperSecretInfoPleaseDoNoPeek---", "payload_content_type": "text/plain" } two_phase_payload_data_bin = { "payload": struct.pack("ihb", 3, 4, 5), "payload_content_type": "application/octet-stream" } 'content-type': 'application/json', 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) secret_id = os.path.split(secret_ref)[1] self.assertIsNotNone(secret_id) resp, body = self.validate_create_secret(secret_id) self.assertIn(one_phase_create_data['payload'], binascii.b2a_base64(body)) 'content-type': 'application/json', 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) resp, body = self.client.put( '/secrets/{0}'.format(secret_id), two_phase_payload_data['payload'], headers={'content-type': two_phase_payload_data['payload_content_type'], 'content-encoding': two_phase_payload_data['payload_content_encoding'], 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) resp, body = self.validate_create_secret(secret_id) self.assertIn(two_phase_payload_data['payload'], binascii.b2a_base64(body)) def test_create_secret_single_phase_plaintext(self): """Covers single phase secret creation. All of the data needed to create the secret, including payload, is provided in a single POST. """ json_data = json.dumps(one_phase_create_data_plaintext) resp, body = self.client.post( '/secrets', json_data, headers={ 'content-type': 'application/json', 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 201) returned_data = json.loads(body) secret_ref = returned_data['secret_ref'] self.assertIsNotNone(secret_ref) secret_id = os.path.split(secret_ref)[1] self.assertIsNotNone(secret_id) resp, body = self.validate_create_secret(secret_id) self.assertEqual(one_phase_create_data_plaintext['payload'], body) def validate_create_secret(self, secret_id): url = '/secrets/%s' % (secret_id) # Get secret metadata resp, body = self.client.get(url, headers={ 'Accept': 'application/json', 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # Get secret data content_type = json.loads(body)['content_types']['default'] resp, body = self.client.get(url, headers={ 'Accept': content_type, 'X-Project-Id': self.client.project_id}) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) return resp, body

subject: Prepare Nova to log to Logstash
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-22 13:23:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/f12986154ae267e4cf34450232ed6945e234dc90', 'message': 'Enable Nova to log to Logstash

By setting log_config=/etc/nova/logging.conf , providing that file and
creating /var/log/nova to hold disk logs.

A human-readable log will be created as nova.log and a JSON-formatted
log will be created as json.log.

Logs are rotated to use at most 20GB, with 18GB allocated to the
human-readable log.

Change-Id: If925856f83e034fc075c4e3d576fbd6739a478c9
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-22 14:53:02.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova-logstash/files/etc/nova/logging.conf', 'elements/nova-logstash/install.d/75-nova-logstash', 'elements/nova-logstash/files/etc/logrotate.d/nova'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/44ac73ab6716df89866ccb854ab497c329953b87', 'message': 'Prepare Nova to log to Logstash

This patch provides a logrotate configuration and a logging.conf for
Nova. To actually enable the latter, the following passthrough snippet
must be provided:

  {
    "nova": {
      "config": [{
        "section": "DEFAULT",
        "values": [{
             "option": "log_config_append",
             "value": "/etc/nova/logging.conf"
        }]
      }]
    }
  }

A human-readable log will be created as nova.log and a JSON-formatted
log will be created as json.log.

Logs are rotated to use at most 20GB, with 18GB allocated to the
human-readable log.

Change-Id: If925856f83e034fc075c4e3d576fbd6739a478c9
'}]
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/87/108687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_config_append=/etc/nova/logging.conf

commit_message:
Add beaver element

This installs beaver. Configuration may be supplied via passthrough.

Advances blueprint logstash.

Change-Id: I9293103dc2720bfdf62be3a37273cb776ff8cb31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/85/108685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux BEAVER_VENV_DIR=${BEAVER_VENV_DIR:-/opt/stack/venvs/beaver} virtualenv ${BEAVER_VENV_DIR} ( set +u . ${BEAVER_VENV_DIR}/bin/activate pip install beaver==31 ) mkdir -p /etc/beaver/conf.d useradd beaver os-svc-daemon -n beaver -d beaver -u beaver -c beaver -- -c /etc/beaver/conf -C /etc/beaver/conf.d

Add elasticsearch element

This simply installs elasticsearch. A future patch can add the ability
to customise the configuration, if required.

Advances blueprint logstash.

Change-Id: I2492b775f6cb096cc2f5838dc1500b99a773f52b

'}]
commit_message:
Add logstash element

This simply installs logstash. A future patch can add the ability to
customise the configuration.

Advances blueprint logstash.

Change-Id: I469bc3005f3ba815e3362451456861da5f40621e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/15/86315/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # defaults for logstash # Start logstash on boot? START=yes # pulled in from the init script; makes things easier. NAME=logstash # location of java JAVA=/usr/bin/java # arguments to pass to java LS_JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx256m -Djava.io.tmpdir=/var/lib/logstash/" PIDFILE=/var/run/logstash.pid # user id to be invoked as LS_USER=logstash # location of the logstas jar file LS_JAR=/opt/logstash/logstash.jar # logstash home location LS_HOME=/var/lib/logstash # logstash log directory LOG_DIR=/var/log/logstash # logstash log file LOG_FILE=$LOG_DIR/$NAME.log # logstash configuration directory CONF_DIR=/etc/logstash/conf.d # Open file limit OPEN_FILES=2048 # Nice level NICE=19 # Set LogStash options LS_OPTS="--log ${LOG_FILE}" # Set a home directory HOME=/var/lib/logstash

subject: Call pkill -P properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-30 13:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/ed217f426e331a2b27235ae4a91f9e3a70934970', 'message': "Call pkill -P properly

We do not want a -<PID>, that's for use with kill, not pkill.

In the process go ahead and announce that we failed to pkill if
in fact we did fail.

This ought to address issues with processes not dying appropriately
in grenade runs when USE_SCREEN=False. The base problem here is
that even when USE_SCREEN=False, processes in icehouse will still be
launched in a screen. Then when ./stop-base is called this pkill
may not match _and_ screen killing portion of screen_stop is not
called because USE_SCREEN=False, despite the fact that screen was in
fact used.

It may be that we'll want to backport the USE_SCREEN/run_process
changes in devstack to icehouse, or just wait until kilo opens.

Change-Id: Id6cbfeec7a871a3c701502c8748f8eb55dcdc3df
"}]
commit_message:
Call pkill -P properly

We do not want a -<PID>, that's for use with kill, not pkill.

In the process go ahead and announce that we failed to pkill if
in fact we did fail.

This ought to address issues with processes not dying appropriately
in grenade runs when USE_SCREEN=False. The base problem here is
that even when USE_SCREEN=False, processes in icehouse will still be
launched in a screen. Then when ./stop-base is called this pkill
may not match _and_ screen killing portion of screen_stop is not
called because USE_SCREEN=False, despite the fact that screen was in
fact used.

It may be that we'll want to backport the USE_SCREEN/run_process
changes in devstack to icehouse, or just wait until kilo opens.

Change-Id: Id6cbfeec7a871a3c701502c8748f8eb55dcdc3df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/54/125054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local service_pid service_pid=$(cat $SERVICE_DIR/$SCREEN_NAME/$1.pid) pkill -TERM -P $service_pid || echo "Failed to pkill $1 at pid:$service_pid"

commit_message:
Don't use DB column names for sort keys

The user shouldn't need to know how data is stored in the database in order
to use the API. Instead, use the same key names as provided in the output
data as possible sort keys.

Change-Id: I02e13e2fb6b1949ef8ee5b9b0b08ed5c8d946c68
Closes-Bug: #1355669

added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <section xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" <title>Starting Corosync</title> <para>Corosync is started as a regular system service. Depending on your distribution, it may ship with an LSB init script, an upstart job, or a systemd unit file. Either way, the service is usually named <systemitem class="service">corosync</systemitem>:</para> <itemizedlist> <listitem> <para> <command>/etc/init.d/corosync start</command> (LSB) </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para> <command>service corosync start</command> (LSB, alternate) </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para> <command>start corosync</command> (upstart) </para> </listitem> <listitem> <para> <command>systemctl start corosync</command> (systemd) </para> </listitem> </itemizedlist> <para>You can now check the Corosync connectivity with two tools.</para> <para>The <command>corosync-cfgtool</command> utility, when invoked with the <option>-s</option> option, gives a summary of the health of the communication rings:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>corosync-cfgtool -s</userinput> <computeroutput>Printing ring status. <para>The <command>corosync-objctl</command> utility can be used to dump the Corosync cluster member list:</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>corosync-objctl runtime.totem.pg.mrp.srp.members</userinput> <computeroutput>runtime.totem.pg.mrp.srp.435324542.ip=r(0) ip(192.168.42.82) r(1) ip(10.0.42.100) <para>You should see a <literal>status=joined</literal> entry for each of your constituent cluster nodes.</para> </section>

commit_message:
Move begin ping listener to a connect listener

The "reconnect" listener that occurs on transaction begin
is not sufficient for libraries that use engines, connections
and sessions in "autocommit" mode, where no transaction is begun.
So we move our "ping" from the begin phase to the "connect"
phase instead.   We use a newer SQLAlchemy event "engine_connect"
so that we can make use of the Connection and all the disconnect/
invalidation facilities that are included, rather than using
the low-level pool listener which is somewhat legacy.
Since the event was added in SQLAlchemy 0.9.0, a compatibility
layer is added which emulates the mechanics of the
handle_error compatibility layer.

Change-Id: I719fe45e657e747e5f8d64f20059e2b61c79b63d
Closes-bug: #1374497

subject: Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 05:24:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/24fdae93605ab966e97820b0bad875de0abdf79c', 'message': "Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached' error with the
secret model. This CR adds code to ensure that when repositories
retrieve a model, it is detached. Logic that depended on this attached
behavior was also addressed.

Change-Id: Ie50e5f03be7b9b12d82a285a71e2f1b5c2483ea0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-26 05:27:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/b84bf8ffe5b65573dfd29f9ff9dbfc967f0682c7', 'message': "Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached' error with the
secret model. This CR adds code to ensure that when repositories
retrieve a model, it is detached. Logic that depended on this attached
behavior was also addressed.

Change-Id: Ie50e5f03be7b9b12d82a285a71e2f1b5c2483ea0
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-26 12:52:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/da899be71fcdddf755ec9e02f61c85defbbf493d', 'message': "Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached' error with the
secret model. This CR adds code to ensure that when repositories
retrieve a model, it is detached. Logic that depended on this attached
behavior was also addressed.

Change-Id: Ie50e5f03be7b9b12d82a285a71e2f1b5c2483ea0
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-29 04:04:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/62719c22c8f87b80cc27820d5095a83901a9f26a', 'message': "Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached in another session'
error with the secret model. This CR moves to the SQLAlchemy scoped
session which ensures one session per thread. This CR also adds a
simple 'smoke test' script that was used to exercise the API during the
development of this CR, and could be helpful for others looking for a
simple way to test and evaluate their local Barbican API instances.

Change-Id: Ie50e5f03be7b9b12d82a285a71e2f1b5c2483ea0
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-29 04:11:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/5dfc9c332a9aa5aaf2647455c38899374f1dd994', 'message': "Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached in another session'
error with the secret model. This CR moves to the SQLAlchemy scoped
session which ensures one session per thread. This CR also adds a
simple 'smoke test' script that was used to exercise the API during the
development of this CR, and could be helpful for others looking for a

commit_message:
Fix error in two-step secret PUT with base64

An attempt to PUT base64-encoded binary data as the 2nd step in storing
a secret resulted in a SQLAlchemy 'already attached in another session'
error with the secret model. This CR moves to the SQLAlchemy scoped
session which ensures one session per thread. This CR also adds a
simple 'smoke test' script that was used to exercise the API during the
development of this CR, and could be helpful for others looking for a
simple way to test and evaluate their local Barbican API instances.

Closes-Bug: #1374270
Change-Id: Ie50e5f03be7b9b12d82a285a71e2f1b5c2483ea0

commit_message:
Make api_extensions_path a parameter for "neutron"

Currently, the "neutron" class does not support the direct configuration
of the "api_extensions_path" by means of a parameter. However, there is
at least one plugin -- OpenContrail -- which currently requires exactly
this parameter to be set to work. It is hence desireable to be able to
set the parameter directly from within the "neutron" class instead of
having to fiddle with "neutron_config" in local site manifests.

This commit adds the desired functionality and allows the parameter via
"api_extensions_path" to be set directly for the "neutron" class.

Change-Id: I660848100073a3a0067ffb42791bfd80b66c808e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/24/124324/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $api_extensions_path = undef, 'DEFAULT/api_extensions_path': value => $api_extensions_path;

commit_message:
Refactor PXE clean up tests

Make this tests really unit test, leave a separate "full flow"
test for checking the most common case without mocks.
Also add missing test for iscsi_deploy.

Change-Id: Idc85efce2d58e41642a4a72c612df4a5f9f12082
Closes-Bug: #1370487

subject: Redact x-subject-token from response headers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-25 07:01:42.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/ebeca911fa291e258c2c0b1ef55a26ff5ac009d2', 'message': 'Redact x-subject-token from response headers

When you invoke any OpenStack API of any of the OpenStack services
e.g. glance, neutron, cinder, heat, ceilometer, nova, keystone
then it logs readable x-subject-token at the debug log level in the
respective log files.

Simply redacting the x-subject-token in keystone client response header
before logging it.

SecurityImpact
Closes-Bug: #1371355
Change-Id: Iac16c6358250677544761beea9f5c5d8ba29afac
'}]
commit_message:
Redact x-subject-token from response headers

When you invoke any OpenStack API of any of the OpenStack services
e.g. glance, neutron, cinder, heat, ceilometer, nova, keystone
then it logs readable x-subject-token at the debug log level in the
respective log files.

Simply redacting the x-subject-token in keystone client response header
before logging it.

SecurityImpact
Closes-Bug: #1371355
Change-Id: Iac16c6358250677544761beea9f5c5d8ba29afac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/54/123954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def process_header(cls, header): """Redacts the secure headers to be logged.""" secure_headers = ('authorization', 'x-auth-token', 'x-subject-token',) if header[0].lower() in secure_headers: return (header[0], 'TOKEN_REDACTED') return header string_parts.append('-H "%s: %s"' % Session.process_header(header)) for header in six.iteritems(headers): string_parts.append('%s: %s' % Session.process_header(header))
deleted_lines: def process_header(header): secure_headers = ('authorization', 'x-auth-token', 'x-subject-token',) if header[0].lower() in secure_headers: return (header[0], 'TOKEN_REDACTED') return header string_parts.append('-H "%s: %s"' % process_header(header)) string_parts.append('%s' % headers)

commit_message:
Improve openstacklib::db::mysql test coverage

* Add tests for openstacklib::db::mysql::host_access
* Add tests for other overridable parameters in db::mysql
* Do not test implementation details of host_access from
  within openstacklib::db::mysql tests.

Change-Id: Ifcf3820a575f932313a62b9d294ebd92a5055cf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/69/124869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'openstacklib::db::mysql::host_access' do let :pre_condition do "include mysql::server\n" + "openstacklib::db::mysql { 'nova':\n" + " password_hash => 'AA1420F182E88B9E5F874F6FBE7459291E8F4601'}" end shared_examples 'openstacklib::db::mysql::host_access examples' do context 'with required parameters' do let (:title) { 'nova_10.0.0.1' } let :params do { :user => 'foobar', :password_hash => 'AA1420F182E88B9E5F874F6FBE7459291E8F4601', :database => 'nova', :privileges => 'ALL' } end it { should contain_mysql_user("#{params[:user]}@10.0.0.1").with( :password_hash => params[:password_hash] )} it { should contain_mysql_grant("#{params[:user]}@10.0.0.1/#{params[:database]}.*").with( :user => "#{params[:user]}@10.0.0.1", :privileges => 'ALL', :table => "#{params[:database]}.*" )} end end context 'on a Debian osfamily' do let :facts do { :osfamily => "Debian" } end include_examples 'openstacklib::db::mysql::host_access examples' end context 'on a RedHat osfamily' do let :facts do { :osfamily => 'RedHat' } end include_examples 'openstacklib::db::mysql::host_access examples' end end

subject: libvirt: Make sure NUMA cell memory is in Kb in XML
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-25 21:25:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0bbce3cca77de440a33e26e9e58fa694e38ee978', 'message': "libvirt: Convert cell memory from KiB to MiB before creating xml

Currently, the NUMA topology and placement feature expects that
each cell's memory is specified in MiB. However, qemu expects
cell memory to be specified in KiB. This causes undesired behavior
when using qemu 2.0.0 or lower and outright prevents machines with
NUMA specs from booting when using qemu 2.1.0. This patch simply
converts the value from MiB to the expected KiB before creating
the guest xml. For a more detailed explanation of the consequences
of this bug, please see the bug report.

Change-Id: Ic4518acf6bcee463009437829646de8c83aff6bf
Closes-bug: #1373159
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-30 10:42:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6a374f21495c12568e4754800574e6703a0e626f', 'message': 'libvirt: Make sure NUMA cell memory is in Kb in XML

This patch makes libvirt report memory in Mb (as
hardware.VirtNUMATopologyUsage class expects Mb) and that when
generating XML we use Kb as this is what libvirt expects by default.

Change-Id: Ic4518acf6bcee463009437829646de8c83aff6bf
Closes-bug: #1373159
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Make sure NUMA cell memory is in Kb in XML

This patch makes libvirt report memory in Mb (as
hardware.VirtNUMATopologyUsage class expects Mb) and that when
generating XML we use Kb as this is what libvirt expects by default.

Change-Id: Ic4518acf6bcee463009437829646de8c83aff6bf
Closes-bug: #1373159

commit_message:
Correct missing vcpupin elements for numa case

We should pin each vcpu into specified numa's cpuset. But the current
code only pin the last vcpu in one cell to specified numa's cpuset.

Change-Id: Ia1cda5e117d7e569e8891bd7c3d03bd6148a0c27
Closes-Bug: #1374902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/124612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cells=[hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCell(0, set([0, 1]), 1024), hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCell(1, set([2, 3]), 1024)])) self.assertEqual(set([0, 1]), cfg.cputune.vcpupin[0].cpuset) self.assertEqual(2, cfg.cputune.vcpupin[2].id) self.assertEqual(set([2]), cfg.cputune.vcpupin[2].cpuset) self.assertEqual(3, cfg.cputune.vcpupin[3].id) self.assertEqual(set([2]), cfg.cputune.vcpupin[3].cpuset)
deleted_lines: cells=[hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCell(0, set([0]), 1024), hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCell(1, set([1]), 1024)])) self.assertEqual(set([2]), cfg.cputune.vcpupin[1].cpuset)

commit_message:
Remove untranslated PO files

The proposal bot only imports file that are at least 75 % translated.
Remove any PO file that is untranslated or has less than 75 % of
translations.

Checked number of translated entries with:

for i in `find . -name *.po `; do msgfmt --statistics -v $i; done

Whenever a file is again translated sufficiently, the proposal bot will
propose a new patch - thus we do not lose any translations.

Change-Id: I642bd23584e7f29f392fbdc8e1e8bdc6d9a12c9e

commit_message:
Make user creation optional when creating service.

In some cases it is useful to be able to just configure
the service in Keystone and not the service user. This
is the case when e.g. a read only LDAP backend is used.
Added parameters configure_user and configure_user_role
(default to true).

Change-Id: I6b0b7e2554e982550d71d8427ce2ea94f04f55e8
Closes-Bug: 1360232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/65/116265/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $configure_user = true, if $configure_user { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'neutron-server' |> } if $configure_user { keystone_user { $auth_name: ensure => present, password => $password, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, } keystone_user_role { "${auth_name}@${tenant}": ensure => present, roles => 'admin', } }
deleted_lines: Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'neutron-server' |> keystone_user { $auth_name: ensure => present, password => $password, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, } keystone_user_role { "${auth_name}@${tenant}": ensure => present, roles => 'admin', }

commit_message:
ignore .idea folder in glance

If we use JetBrains PyCharm as python develop tool, JetBrains PyCharm
would automatically generate its config folder name .idea in the root
dir of your python code.
Many Code projects, such as nova and cinder, have ignore .idea folder.
Project glance should also ignore .idea folder.

Change-Id: I1e3ba1936c8b918aa4669c2d7fceac23a23ca974
Closes-Bug: #1362451
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/46/117446/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
no way to delete valid and invalid security rule

Previously deleting correct/incorrect security
group rule was throwing the error of
"AttributeError". With this fix, now the valid
and invalid security group rules can be deleted.

Change-Id: Id1ef3ec663e930b726b93803b22c58f7302dcc38
Closes-Bug: #1163469

subject: Force the SSH commands to use their default language
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-25 14:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ssh.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8ba03ed0bcd078edd7f5979b89c82a57671c95a2', 'message': 'Force the SSH commands to use their default language

SSH commands often have to parse an output and do some pattern matchings
(e.g using grep) that makes those commands dependent on the system
language and causing it to fail on systems with a non-english locale
setting.

This patch forces the SSH commands to use their default language
(whatever language the strings in the application was written in) for
output by passing LC_ALL=C as part of the command. For virsh, vmware,
vbox and prlctl the default language is english making the commands from
the SSH driver to work independent of the system language.

Closes-Bug: #1373671
Change-Id: I175d84fca4e10b8c9468bc4fe54ecd865725e39c
'}]
commit_message:
Force the SSH commands to use their default language

SSH commands often have to parse an output and do some pattern matchings
(e.g using grep) that makes those commands dependent on the system
language and causing it to fail on systems with a non-english locale
setting.

This patch forces the SSH commands to use their default language
(whatever language the strings in the application was written in) for
output by passing LC_ALL=C as part of the command. For virsh, vmware,
vbox and prlctl the default language is english making the commands from
the SSH driver to work independent of the system language.

Closes-Bug: #1373671
Change-Id: I175d84fca4e10b8c9468bc4fe54ecd865725e39c

commit_message:
Revert "api: add serial console API calls v2"

As described on the bug - the current implementation makes no sense
without an actual client, and depending on the client, the
implementation will need to change, so we don't want this to be a part
of the API since it will not work as is and may need to change.

This reverts commit e89eaf9a7d1f79420648038819ae2481b47fedb3.

Change-Id: Icb1c4ef3bd267267e3fd0bb2d43aa34e2ca79a61
Partial-bug: #1373950

commit_message:
Revert "cmd: add nova-serialproxy service"

As described on the bug - the current implementation makes no sense
without an actual client, and depending on the client, the
implementation will need to change, so we don't want to ship a useless
service.

This reverts commit ea8323eca4f16e4af39d42ac28227aaa5e681d00.

Change-Id: I0db5866d9da688bfa02da850f82e5371c2e3cc3e
Partial-bug: #1373950

confusing and unnecessary.

commit_message:
Fix DB2 and nosql ceilometer dbsync

* Remove very old and now incorrect check for running
ceilometer-dbsync with nosql.  This is fine to do now, and is
needed when nosql is used for DB2 with ceilometer.

Change-Id: Id31d7dffb3e01513bb0470a7a6f5f07118dc28ef
Closes-Bug: #1373600

commit_message:
Always reset target_power_state in node_power_action

Currently under some conditions target_power_state can be left
on the node, making it impossible to operate on via API.

Change-Id: Iba92c9bfae3616661cadf602618a66d2664264ee
Closes-Bug: #1375641

commit_message:
Fix selinux permissions for non-primary MariaDB/Galera nodes

Galera nodes started after the bootstrap node will use rsync (and
a few other cmds) to sync up with master; yet on Fedora 20 this
is causing a number of selinux AVC denials.

Fedora bug is https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1145619

Change-Id: Ifb97b3f92fefdef1d57c87907292aeb4a27c3a49
Closes-bug: 1373150

commit_message:
Functional tests for metadata seeding for glance-manage

Currently there are no functional tests for metadata seeding for
glance-manage. This tests should cover a specific lifecycle of metadata
using three api methods:

db_load_metadefs
db_unload_metadefs
db_export_metadefs

This tests also concerns json files stored in /glance/etc/metadefs.

Change-Id: Icd237252b6374d7457c2636f805a830c241d0a94
Closes-Bug: #1373936
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/06/125006/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonimport re import sqlite3 def _load_metadefs(self): cmd = ('%s -m glance.cmd.manage --config-file %s db_load_metadefs' % (sys.executable, self.conf_filepath)) return execute(cmd, raise_error=True) def _unload_metadefs(self): cmd = ('%s -m glance.cmd.manage --config-file %s db_unload_metadefs' % (sys.executable, self.conf_filepath)) return execute(cmd, raise_error=True) def _export_metadefs(self): cmd = ('%s -m glance.cmd.manage --config-file %s db_export_metadefs' % (sys.executable, self.conf_filepath)) return execute(cmd, raise_error=True) def _assert_execute_no_error(self, exitcode, out, err): self.assertEqual(exitcode, 0) self.assertEqual(out, '') self.assertEqual(err, '') def _assert_count_metadefs_in_db(self, db_dict): with sqlite3.connect(self.db_filepath) as conn: for table_name, number in db_dict.iteritems(): cursor = conn.cursor() cursor.execute(''.join(['SELECT count(*) FROM ', table_name])) row = cursor.fetchone() self.assertEqual((number,), row) def _assert_export_metadefs(self): with sqlite3.connect(self.db_filepath) as conn: cursor = conn.cursor() cursor.execute('SELECT display_name FROM metadef_namespaces') pattern = re.compile('[\W_]+', re.UNICODE) namespaces = cursor.fetchall() for namespace in namespaces: namespace_file_name = ''.join([pattern.sub('', namespace[0]), '.json']) file_path = ''.join(['/etc/glance/metadefs/', namespace_file_name]) with open(file_path) as json_file: metadata = json.load(json_file) self.assertEqual(namespace[0].encode('utf-8'), metadata[ 'display_name'].encode('utf-8')) @depends_on_exe('sqlite3') @skip_if_disabled def test_metadefs_lifecycle(self): #executing db_sync to create database self._sync_db(True) #load a metadefs (exitcode, out, err) = self._load_metadefs() self._assert_execute_no_error(exitcode, out, err) #metadefs should exists in the database db_dict = { 'metadef_namespace_resource_types': 15, 'metadef_namespaces': 11, 'metadef_objects': 3, 'metadef_properties': 39 } self._assert_count_metadefs_in_db(db_dict) #unload metadefs (exitcode, out, err) = self._unload_metadefs() self._assert_execute_no_error(exitcode, out, err) #metadefs should not exists in the database db_dict = { 'metadef_namespace_resource_types': 0, 'metadef_namespaces': 0, 'metadef_objects': 0, 'metadef_properties': 0 } self._assert_count_metadefs_in_db(db_dict) #NOTE(bfic): there is no need to check asserts again, # it is done in previous case self._load_metadefs() #export metadefs (exitcode, out, err) = self._export_metadefs() self._assert_execute_no_error(exitcode, out, err) #database metadefs should be exported to json files self._assert_export_metadefs()

This patch allows to overwrite the parameter.

commit_message:
Greatly reduce code duplication in rspec tests of db::mysql

Use shared examples to avoid duplicating tests for both platforms.

Change-Id: I16a77a284070e243c2a46675af419e635a139969

commit_message:
cmd: update the default behavior of serial console

When using serial console we are expecting using a plain websocket
so we should to return the 'ws://' scheme as the default one, also
it makes no sense to handle webserving content since currently
nothing has been implemented in favor of this case.

DocImpact: The 'base_url' option serial_console has been updated
Closes-Bug: #1373950
Change-Id: I0d0e4f7060febec5e0a357cd3e8c05486f2afaa5

commit_message:
Adds tests for Hyper-V VM Utils

Adds unit tests for Hyper-V VMUtils and VMUtilsV2 classes.

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Teleaga <bteleaga@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partial-Bug: #1220256
(cherry picked from commit cafa300a72313ccc7831f20ac1ca0df117a47cf5)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py
	nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vmutilsv2.py

Change-Id: I87a13697b0a83dc8905573081f735b542bc9bf17

commit_message:
Ironic driver must wait for power state changes

The Ironic virt driver was previously returning from power_on,
power_off, and reboot calls immediately after making the request to
Ironic -- but before Ironic had necessarily acted upon it. This could
lead to Nova acting as though the state change was complete before it
actually was.

This patch introduces a new private method which polls Ironic until it
signals that the power state change is complete. With this, the
power_on, power_off, and reboot methods wait for the action to complete
before returning to ComputeManager.

Closes-bug: #1310135

Change-Id: I0bbdd8bc8807a0df43a420825f497842b387c4d5
